videos.title: Context Platform Engineering to Reduce Token Anxiety ‚Äî Val Bercovici, WEKA
videos.description:
Context Platform Engineering is the set of skills and tools to design, size, and configure systems optimized for Agent Swarm Context, at any scale.

‚ÄúKV-cache hit rate is the single most important metric for a production-stage AI agent‚Äú according to Manus AI. Context platform engineering simplifies the maximization of KV Cache hit rates.

This talk covers WEKA‚Äôs new open source context platform engineering toolkit, which helps translate Service Level Agreement (SLA) requirements of AI Agents, into Agent+LLM inference platform Service Level Objectives (SLOs) which meet required SLAs.

We present research results from WEKA Labs which provide new observability into both unit, and aggregate KV Cache hit rates, consumed by agent swarms of various leading AI coding agents.

This talk concludes with benchmark results for sizing agent swarm context for arbitrary working sets. Including context window sizes, latency, concurrency, and throughput SLOs per agent unit (swarm or sub-task) across modern GPU memory hierarchies, supporting KV Cache offloading plug-ins like vLLM/LMCache, SGLang HiCache, and NVIDIA Dynamo KVBM/NIXL.

Callan Fox is the product leader for Context Platforms at WEKA, following a series of technical expertise and leadership roles at Dell/EMC, CGI and HPE.
Val Bercovici is the Chief AI Officer at WEKA. Previously he was CTO of NetApp/SolidFire, and founding governing board member of the Kubernetes CNCF in the Linux Foundation.

---
Resources:
- https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/visual-guide-how-ai-agents-use-inference-inside-llm-callan-fox-q9brc
- https://medium.com/@callan.j.fox/evaluating-management-of-kv-cache-within-an-inference-system-2d7c3d266c3a

videos.title: Context Engineering: Connecting the Dots with Graphs ‚Äî Stephen Chin, Neo4j
videos.description:
AI systems need more than intelligence; they need context. Without it, even the most advanced models can misinterpret information, lose track of details, or arrive at conclusions that don‚Äôt hold up. Context engineering is emerging as a discipline that shapes how AI perceives, recalls, and reasons about information.

This talk will explore how context provides the foundation for reasoning, problem solving, and explainability in AI. We will look at techniques such as connected memory, contextual retrieval, and graph-based knowledge representation that give large language models a more reliable way to connect information and draw logical conclusions.

Attendees will come away with a practical understanding of how to design effective context pipelines that align AI with real-world knowledge and user intent, and why context engineering is becoming a central part of building trustworthy and impactful AI systems.

Stephen Chin is VP of Developer Relations at Neo4j, conference chair of the LF AI & Data Foundation, and author of numerous titles including the upcoming GraphRAG: The Definitive Guide for O'Reilly. He has given keynotes and main stage talks at numerous conferences around the world including AI Engineer Summit, AI DevSummit, Devoxx, DevNexus, JNation, JavaOne, Shift, Joker, swampUP, and GIDS. Stephen is an avid motorcyclist who has done evangelism tours in Europe, Japan, and Brazil, interviewing developers in their natural habitat. When he is not traveling, he enjoys teaching kids how to do AI, embedded, and robot programming together with his daughters.

---

- X (Twitter): https://x.com/steveonjava

- Company: Neo4j (https://neo4j.com)

He still ships code, tinkers with Raspberry Pi Kubernetes clusters for fun, and is passionate about weaving project‚Äëmanagement smarts with practical AI. videos.title: Claude Just Introduced a New Way To Fix Your UI
videos.description:
In this video, Claude finally shows how to fix basic AI-designed UIs using powerful Claude Skills inside Claude Code. I also test Claude AI in real projects, using Claude Code VSCode setups to see how creative it can actually get.

üîó Resources Mentioned

Improving Front-End Design Through Skills
https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills

Claude Skills Explained
https://www.claude.com/blog/skills-explained

Web Artifacts Builder Skill (GitHub)
https://github.com/anthropics/skills/blob/main/web-artifacts-builder/SKILL.md

In this video, we take a deep dive into how Claude approaches front-end design and why so many AI-generated UIs still look basic. Using Claude Skills, Claude Code, and the new design-focused features from Claude AI, I break down how you can push your AI to create genuinely aesthetic layouts instead of the usual safe, generic outputs.

We explore real examples, test Skills inside actual projects, and compare how these instructions reshape everything‚Äîfrom typography to themes, gradients, and component structure. If you're into AI coding, vibe coding, or building full projects with an AI partner, this video shows how far you can push design quality with the right system prompts.

You'll also see how Claude behaves inside Claude Code VSCode, what works, what breaks, and how the MCP ecosystem ties into all of this. I also compare Claude vs ChatGPT and explain how tools like Claude Code MCP and Claude MCP help load specialized expertise exactly when the model needs it.

Whether you‚Äôre experimenting with AI tools, exploring new artificial intelligence workflows, or just want to learn how to use Claude for front-end design, this breakdown shows how the new Claude 4 models actually perform when put to the test.

videos.title: Gemini 3.0 Pro Is Unreal: Modern Websites, HTML Canvas & 3D Graphics From One Prompt!
videos.description:
Gemini 3.0 Pro Is Unreal: Modern Websites, HTML Canvas & 3D Graphics From One Prompt!

Code A Program....

Gemini 3 Pro just changed the game. üöÄ
In this video, I push Gemini 3 Canvas to its limits ‚Äî full landing pages üåê, interactive tools üß©, 3D effects üåÄ, React apps ‚öõÔ∏è, Three.js scenes üéÆ, and even HTML Canvas animations ‚ö°‚Ä¶ all from simple prompts.

üîó Official Gemini Links:
Gemini Website: https://gemini.google.com
Gemini 3 Announcement: https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3/

I tested everything:
‚ö° Cyberpunk voltage landing page with glitch effects
üß© Interactive SaaS tool (‚ÄúRegexGod‚Äù)
üåÄ 3D Canvas-based ‚ÄúVolt‚Äù webpage
‚öõÔ∏è Fully coded React.js SaaS landing page
üî¥ Perfectly rendered 3D Pok√©mon ball in Three.js

Prompts I Used:

1. VOLTAGE Web
The aesthetic should be 'Cyberpunk High-Voltage.' Think neon yellows and blacks, glitch effects, and raw energy. It should feel aggressive but premium.
----------------------------------------
2. Regex Web:
The "Interactive SaaS" Test
Target: Testing Logic, DOM manipulation, and Micro-interactions.Why it‚Äôs hard: It requires the AI to build a "mini-app" inside the landing page, not just static text.
Act as a Senior Frontend Engineer. Build a landing page for a developer tool called 'RegexGod: AI for Regular Expressions.
The Hero Section (The Hook):
Instead of a static image, the hero section must be a functional playground.
Input field A: 'Enter text here.'
Input field B: 'Enter Regex pattern.'
Result: Real-time highlighting of the text that matches the pattern.
Note: You must write the JS logic to make this actually work in the browser.
The Design System:
Use a 'Dark Mode IDE' aesthetic. Monospace fonts, syntax highlighting colors (Dracula theme), and a minimalist UI.
Deep Think (Reasoning):
Before coding, explain how you will handle the real-time validation efficiently to avoid crashing the browser on long strings.
-------------------------------------------------
3. Canvas central cylinder
Create a single-file HTML solution.
Background: Use the HTML5 Canvas API to create a background of crackling lightning bolts that randomly strike the screen.
Scroll Interaction: As I scroll down, the product can (a central cylinder) should rotate 360 degrees (use CSS 3D transforms) and 'explode' into its ingredients.
Typography: Use massive, stretched kinetic typography that moves horizontally as the user scrolls vertically.
Every project was generated in one shot using Gemini 3 Canvas ‚Äî no rewriting, no extra prompting. This model is already outperforming GPT-5.1 and Claude 4.5 in key reasoning, coding, and multimodal tasks, and the results speak for themselves.
--------------------------------------------------
4. SaaS 
create a AI SaaS landing page for budget tracker
--------------------------------------------------
5. 3D Pokeman ball
create a 3D Pokeman ball using three js
---------------------------------------------------

If you‚Äôre a developer, designer, or AI builder, this is the clearest look at what Gemini 3 can actually do in real workflows: website generation, UI design, animations, 3D visuals, and production-level code.

üéØ What you‚Äôll learn:
How Gemini 3 Canvas builds complete HTML/CSS/JS websites
How to test landing-page prompts effectively
How to generate full SaaS UIs & tools with one prompt
How Canvas handles animations, parallax, and 3D effects
How Gemini 3 compares to GPT-5.1 and Claude 4.5 in practice

üî• If you want more deep-dives, breakdowns, and real developer tests, make sure to subscribe. More Gemini 3 content is coming.

videos.title: Power BI Desktop MCP v2: Automate Semantic Models with AI
videos.description:
In this video I put my Power BI Desktop MCP server v2 to a real test: can an AI agent build a complete semantic model from scratch?

Using Claude Code with local MCP support, I let an LLM drive an 8-phase workflow:
- connect to SQL Server
- import the Contoso tables
- optimize the model
- create measures
- define UDFs
- add age buckets
- apply translations
- document everything it has done

This is an experiment, not a polished marketing demo. I show where it works well, where it fails, and how easy it is for a powerful MCP to push a model into a corrupted state if you are not careful.

What you will see:
- Overview of my MCP server for Power BI Desktop (v2)
- How I prompt the LLM to work in clearly defined phases
- Running the workflow in Claude Code planning mode with agents
- Automatic table import and star schema creation on the Contoso 10k database
- Measures, UDFs, age buckets, and a dedicated measures table
- Date table configuration, relationships, and basic model hygiene
- Spanish translations created via MCP tools
- Validating what the LLM claims it did against the actual Power BI model
- Token / context usage for a full semantic-model build

Tools used:
- Power BI Desktop with my MCP server (Model Context Protocol) v2
- SQL Server Contoso sample database (10k row version)
- Claude Code with local MCP support
- DAX and semantic modeling best-practice documents as extra context

Important:
This MCP is powerful enough to put your model into a corrupted state if misused. Always:
- Work on a copy of your PBIX or PBIP
- Keep backups / version control
- Manually verify relationships, measures, and transformations
- Treat the LLM output as a starting point, not ground truth

Links:
- MCP server for Power BI Desktop (repo / docs): https://github.com/maxanatsko/PowerBI-Desktop-MCP
- My Websites: http://maxanatsko.com

Chapters:
00:00 Intro ‚Äì MCP server v2 and experiment goal
00:30 Contoso database, schema CSV, best-practice docs
00:57 LLM role, connection details, 10k-row Contoso version
01:30 The 8 phases overview
03:40 Running the experiment in Claude Code (planning mode + agents)
06:48 Power BI Desktop starts importing tables (model gets data)
07:10 Optimization agent ‚Äì formats, keys, date table, SummarizeBy
07:34 Measures development agent
08:39 Spanish culture and translations agent
09:07 Corrupted-state risk and rollback
10:24 All 8 phases complete ‚Äì reviewing the agent report
12:16 First inconsistencies (AutoDateTables vs DiscourageImplicitMeasures)
13:16 Age buckets, measures table, display folders
15:10 ‚ÄúModels can lie‚Äù ‚Äì verifying what actually changed
15:49 Inspecting the model in Power BI (measures, buckets, relationships)
17:19 Power Query, parameters, SQL connection table
18:10 Context usage and final takeaway

___
#powerbi #powerbidesktop #mcp #modelcontextprotocol #claudecode #aiagents #warpbi #ModelContextProtocol #Claude #LLM #DataEngineering #BusinessIntelligence #DAX #PowerBIAutomation

videos.title: Connect Claude AI to Power BI Desktop | NEW Microsoft Power BI Modeling MCP Server Tutorial
videos.description:
YOUTUBE DESCRIPTION:
üöÄ Connect Claude AI to Power BI Desktop | NEW Microsoft Power BI Modeling MCP Server Tutorial
Discover how to integrate Claude AI directly with Power BI Desktop using Microsoft's brand new Power BI Modeling MCP Server! In this video, I show you the exact steps to connect Claude to your semantic models and create DAX measures using natural language.
üîó Essential Links:
VS Code Download:
https://code.visualstudio.com
Claude Desktop Download:
https://claude.ai/download
Power BI Modeling MCP Server (GitHub):
https://github.com/microsoft/PowerBI-Modeling-MCP
MCP Documentation:
https://modelcontextprotocol.io/introduction
‚öôÔ∏è Step-by-Step Setup (Exact Steps From Video):
STEP 1: INSTALL VS CODE

Go to code.visualstudio.com
Download and install
Check "Add to PATH" during install
Launch it

STEP 2: INSTALL THE MCP EXTENSION
[In VS Code]

Click Extensions (left sidebar)
Search: "Power BI Modeling MCP Server"
Publisher: Analysis Services
Click Install

STEP 3: GET THE FILE PATH

Open File Explorer (Windows Key + E)
Click in the address bar at the top
Type or paste: %USERPROFILE%.vscode\extensions
Press Enter
Scroll down and look for a folder that starts with: analysis-services.powerbi-modeling-mcp
Double-click to open that folder
Open the server folder
You'll see powerbi-modeling-mcp.exe - that's what we need!
Right-click on powerbi-modeling-mcp.exe
Select Copy as path

STEP 4: INSTALL CLAUDE DESKTOP

Go to claude.ai/download
Download and install
Launch Claude Desktop

STEP 5: CONFIGURE
[In Claude Desktop]

File ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Developer ‚Üí Edit Config
Paste this configuration:

json{
  "mcpServers": {
    "powerbi-modeling-mcp": {
      "command": "YOUR_PATH_HERE",
      "args": ["--start"],
      "type": "stdio"
    }
  }
}

Replace YOUR_PATH_HERE with your path from earlier
Use double backslashes: C:\\Users\\...
Save and close
Fully quit Claude Desktop (check system tray)
Reopen Claude Desktop

STEP 6: TEST IT

Open any saved .pbix file in Power BI Desktop
In Claude Desktop, type:
"Connect to open Power BI report in desktop"
Then create measures with natural language:
"Create a time intelligence DAX measure for year to date on total revenue. Put it in the metrics folder"

üìã Prerequisites:

Windows OS
VS Code
Claude Desktop (free tier works!)
Power BI Desktop installed

üí° What You Can Do:
‚úÖ Create DAX measures using natural language
‚úÖ List and explore tables, columns, and measures
‚úÖ Query your data model conversationally
‚úÖ Build time intelligence calculations automatically
‚úÖ Update and modify existing measures

videos.title: Gemini 3 Pro: My Independent Benchmark Results Revealed!
videos.description:
# Gemini 3 Pro vs Claude Sonnet 4.5: Complete Comparison & Testing | Interactive 3D Animations

Signup:  https://bit.ly/abacusai-chatllm

## üìå Overview
In this video, I conduct an extensive side-by-side comparison between **Gemini 3 Pro** and **Claude Sonnet 4.5**, testing their capabilities in generating interactive 3D animations, visualizations, and complex code. Watch as we explore terrain simulations, solar systems, particle effects, city generation, and much more!

## üéØ What You'll Learn
- Detailed performance comparison between Gemini 3 Pro and Claude Sonnet 4.5
- Real-world testing of both models across multiple 3D.js applications
- Benchmark results: errors, warnings, generation speed, and pass rates
- Visual quality assessment of interactive animations and simulations

## üöÄ Key Features of Gemini 3 Pro
- **Multimodal Support**: Text, image, video, audio, and PDF inputs
- **Massive Context Window**: 1 million input tokens, 64,000 output tokens
- **Up-to-Date Knowledge**: Cutoff date of January 2025
- **Advanced Architecture**: Sparse mixture of experts model
- **Built-in Tools**: Function calling, structured output, search, and code execution
- **Availability**: Gemini App, Google AI Studio, and ChatLM from Abacus AI

## ‚è∞ Timestamps
- 0:00 - Introduction
- 2:31 - Sea Visualisation in three.js
- 2:49 - Benchmark Results Analysis
- 3:20 - Rotating Cube Simulation
- 3:44 - Data-Driven Dashboard Comparison

- 5:49 - Terrain Flight Mode Comparison
- 6:29 - City Generator Showcase
- 6:45 - Particle System Simulation
- 7:09 - Google AI Studio Integration
- 7:31 - Google Anti-Gravity Code Editor Announcement

## üî¨ Benchmark Results Summary
**Gemini 3 Pro Preview:**
- 48 warnings (vs Claude's 93)
- ~50 seconds average generation time
- Superior performance on multiple benchmarks
- Better than Claude Sonnet 4.5 and GPT-5.1 in tested scenarios

**Claude Sonnet 4.5:**
- 93 warnings
- Slightly slower generation
- Excellent visual quality with enhanced shadows and details
- More natural-looking terrain simulations

## üé® Projects Tested
1. **Rotating Cube Simulation** - Basic 3D rendering comparison
2. **Data-Driven Dashboard** - Interactive controls, multiple views, theme toggle
3. **Molecule Explorer** - DNA sequences, chemical structures, animation controls
4. **Product Configurator** - Color changes, material finishes, multiple viewing angles
5. **Solar System Simulation** - Planetary motion, speed controls
6. **Terrain Flight Mode** - Landscape generation and navigation
7. **City Generator** - Dynamic urban environments with day/night cycles
8. **Particle System** - Explosion, spiral, flow, and swarm effects

## üí° Key Takeaways
- **Gemini 3 Pro** excels in: Speed, fewer errors, smooth animations, game-like graphics
- **Claude Sonnet 4.5** excels in: Visual quality, natural aesthetics, detailed shadows
- Both models are highly capable for 3D visualization and interactive applications
- Choice depends on specific use case: performance vs visual fidelity

On top of that, Google confirmed multiple new features: Gemini in Maps, global rollout of Google Opal, and the launch of Ads Advisor + Analytics Advisor for ads and commerce teams.

We also saw exciting new tests of Nano Banana 2, showing near-perfect image reasoning, text reconstruction, and ultra-accurate UI screenshot generation ‚Äî the closest model yet to replacing Photoshop.

Anthropic shared a fascinating robotics experiment where Claude helped engineers with zero robotics experience outperform a traditional team, raising huge questions about AI-assisted robotics. But on the darker side, Anthropic also revealed a major AI-led cyberattack leveraging Claude Code and MCP servers ‚Äî showcasing the emerging threat of ‚Äúvibe hacking.‚Äù

videos.title: Google Gemini 3 Is a Powerhouse!
videos.description:
Google has finally dropped Gemini 3, and it is much more than just a simple version update. Today, we are diving deep into Google‚Äôs flagship AI model to see if the "vibe coding," the new Gemini Agent, and the experimental Anti-Gravity platform actually live up to the massive hype.

In this video, I put Gemini 3 through the wringer. We‚Äôre moving past the benchmarks (though we cover those too) and getting into real-world testing. I challenged the model to code a Doom clone from scratch, write a supernatural heist movie script, and generate interactive web interfaces on the fly.

We also take a look at the new multimodal capabilities that supposedly make this the best agentic model in the world. Is this the update that puts Google back on top? Let's find out.

In this video, we cover:

Gemini Agent (Project Mariner): How it handles deep research across your Google ecosystem.

Vibe Coding: Building "Hell Maze" and "Missile Command" in one shot.

Generative Interfaces: Creating dynamic websites from simple prompts.

videos.title: Google's Gemini 3.0: The Most Powerful LLM Ever
videos.description:
Get a private, on-screen walkthrough of Google‚Äôs new Gemini 3.0 with Logan Kilpatrick from Google Deepmind. We vibe-code full apps, games, and product UIs in real time. You‚Äôll see how to go from raw idea to working product in a single prompt, then iterate visually with design, features, and AI workflows. They turn an IdeaBrowser concept into a live talent-matching platform, screenshot-clone the IdeaBrowser UI, wire up a ‚Äúgenerate tomorrow‚Äôs idea‚Äù feature grounded in Google Search, and even add co-founder matching on top. If you‚Äôre building with AI or still on the fence, this episode shows what‚Äôs now possible with Gemini 3.0 Pro in AI Studio.

*Timestamps*
00:00 ‚Äì Intro
01:00 ‚Äì What Gemini 3 is and where it lives (Gemini app, AI Studio, API)
03:03 ‚Äì Vibe Coding 3D games
09:27 ‚Äì Vibe Coding an idea from IdeaBrowser
25:02 ‚Äì Screenshot-cloning the IdeaBrowser UI and regenerating it in Gemini

*Key Points*

* Gemini 3.0 Pro in AI Studio lets you ‚Äúvibe code‚Äù full apps‚ÄîUI, logic, and AI features‚Äîfrom natural-language prompts, then iteratively refine them.
* Games and complex simulations are a stress-test and showcase for the model‚Äôs capabilities, not just toys.
* You can paste an entire business idea (like IdeaBrowser‚Äôs generational talent-matching concept) into AI Studio and get a working, multi-screen product with AI-powered workflows.
* Gemini 3.0 Pro is free to use inside AI Studio up to generous limits, and the API is priced at $2 per million input tokens and $12 per million output tokens under 200K input tokens.
* Screenshot-driven UI cloning plus ‚Äúadd five more features‚Äù prompts are powerful loops for product and UX ideation.
* You can layer social features like co-founder matching directly on top of idea-discovery products with only a few additional prompts.

Section Summaries

1) Why Gemini 3.0 Is an ‚ÄúUnfair Advantage‚Äù
Greg frames the episode as an inside look at Google‚Äôs new Gemini 3.0, promising listeners a practical ‚Äúunfair advantage‚Äù in how to use it. Logan explains Gemini 3‚Äôs mission‚Äîhelping you ‚Äúbring anything to life,‚Äù from receipts and papers to app ideas‚Äîand outlines where it‚Äôs available: the Gemini app, AI Studio, and APIs for developers and enterprises. 

2) Vibe Coding Landing Pages and Games
Inside AI Studio‚Äôs vibe-coding experience, Logan shows that a single prompt can generate polished landing pages and immersive 3D games. They discuss games as both marketing assets (e.g., branded runners for companies) and as a proxy for the model‚Äôs sophistication, since game logic and UX are hard to build by hand. 

3) Turning an IdeaBrowser Concept into a Working App
Greg introduces an IdeaBrowser concept: a generational gap talent-matching platform pairing junior AI developers with senior industry veterans. Logan copies the idea‚Äôs full text into AI Studio and asks Gemini to ‚Äúmake it fully functional,‚Äù resulting in a live app with landing page, talent profiles, fit analysis, and an enterprise team-builder that evaluates roster balance. 

4) Debugging, Annotating, and Deploying Vibe-Coded Apps
As they explore, they hit common vibe-coding friction points: a mis-placed ‚ÄúSend‚Äù button and a blank preview due to missing files. Logan demonstrates the annotate tool (boxing UI elements and attaching instructions) and the simple fix of telling the model ‚Äúthe screen is white‚Äù so it regenerates the correct structure, then describes how you can deploy, share, and iterate on these apps with teammates or customers. 

5) Screenshot-Cloning IdeaBrowser and Generating Tomorrow‚Äôs Ideas
They screenshot IdeaBrowser‚Äôs UI and ask Gemini to ‚Äúclone this UI exactly‚Äù while adding a ‚Äúgenerate tomorrow‚Äôs idea‚Äù button grounded in Google Search. The model recreates a close visual match and builds a feature that pulls current AI governance trends to generate a new idea (‚ÄúEthos AI‚Äù) with positioning, offer, and starter kit concepts‚Äîshowing how screenshots become launchpads for new verticals or geos.

videos.title: 9 REQUIRED Finance Lessons for Founders
videos.description:
Master Your Cashflow (Templates Included): https://startup-ideas-pod.link/money-map

On this episode, I share my simple financial operating system that helps me run my business. I share actual workflows that have saved one of my portfolio company from an 11-week runway crisis (when they thought they had 8 months), and the templates behind his 13-week cash tracker, Bear/Base/Bull decision framework, and one-page board report. This is a rare look inside the tactics I use to think about cash flow, dilution strategy, and building companies that don't run out of runway by accident.

Bank with Brex: https://startup-ideas-pod.link/brex-sip

Timestamps
00:00 ‚Äì Intro: The whiteboard that saved two companies
02:08 ‚Äì The Financial Rhythm: Daily, weekly, monthly cadence
03:23 ‚Äì Rule 1: The 13-Week Cash Flow System
06:10 ‚Äì Rule 2: Cash vs. Accrual
08:14 ‚Äì Rule 3: Extend Runway
12:13 ‚Äì Rule 4: Be Exit Ready
15:06 ‚Äì Rule 5: Cards and Credit
18:01 ‚Äì Rule 6: Track 5 Weekly Metrics
20:00 ‚Äì Rule 7: The Monthly One-Pager
21:12 ‚Äì Rule 8: Tools and Automation
26:11 ‚Äì Rule 9: Dilution Mindset
27:59 ‚Äì How to implement: The weekly rhythm in practice
29:31 ‚Äì Action plan and closing

Key Points
* Your P&L lies about survival‚Äîone portfolio company thought they had 8 months of runway but actually had 11 weeks when mapped to real cash flow
* The Bear/Base/Bull decision framework prevents emotional spending: if two-plus scenarios say no, wait (a $60K conference booth was rejected in bear case, approved two months later in bull case)
* Acquisitions happen in 48 hours‚Äîkeep a 10-file data room updated quarterly so you can respond to Tuesday emails with Wednesday meetings
* Trust doesn't scale, policy does: weekly corporate card reviews caught an $8K personal ad spend in 7 days instead of 30
* The system runs itself once built: 15 minutes Monday + 30 minutes Friday + 4 hours/month replaces heroic monthly scrambles
* Every dollar raised costs ownership forever‚Äîcutting $40K/month burn has the same 12-month runway impact as fundraising but with 0% dilution

videos.title: Google's Gemini CodeWiki: This is ACTUALLY REALLY COOL & IT'S FREE!
videos.description:
In this video, I‚Äôll be telling you about Google‚Äôs new Code Wiki, how it auto-generates living documentation for your repositories, and how the upcoming Gemini CLI extension could bring all of this into your private codebases.

--
Key Takeaways:

üß† Google Code Wiki creates a continuously updated, structured wiki for your repos, tied directly to the actual code.
üìö Documentation is automatically regenerated after each change, fixing the problem of stale READMEs and outdated architecture notes.
üí¨ A built-in Gemini-powered chat uses the wiki as its brain, so answers are context-aware and specific to your repository.
üìä Code Wiki auto-generates architecture, class, and sequence diagrams that always reflect the current state of the code.
üîê A Gemini CLI extension is coming so you can run Code Wiki locally on internal and private repos, keeping everything secure.
‚ö†Ô∏è Right now the web experience is focused on public repos, with open questions around pricing, large monorepos, and complex codegen.
üé• For some projects, it can even generate a full explainer video via NotebookLM based on your code and documentation.
üöÄ Overall, it‚Äôs a promising step toward ‚Äúliving documentation‚Äù that helps teams ship faster instead of getting stuck deciphering legacy code.

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ OpenAI has released GPT‚Äë5.1, GPT‚Äë5.1 Codex, and Mini Codex with major improvements in instruction following and tool usage.  
‚ö° GPT‚Äë5.1 Codex performs strongly, scoring 9th overall, and shows major improvements over the previous generation.

üìâ Mini Codex performs poorly, placing 32nd, making it unsuitable for complex tasks.  
üí¨ GPT‚Äë5.1 High Reasoning ranks 16th, offering solid but slower performance.  
üß™ KiloCode testing shows the model is good for planning and debugging but too slow for pair programming.  
üí∏ Pricing remains unchanged, and caching via Responses API is improved with 24‚Äëhour retention.  
üèéÔ∏è Speed remains a major downside ‚Äî only ~18 tokens per second, far slower than competitors.  
üìä Overall, the new Codex models are improved but still finicky and slow for real development work.

videos.title: Gemini 3 (FINAL Checkpoints Tested): I TESTED EVERY CHECKPOINT of Gemini-3. It's dropping this month
videos.description:
In this video, I‚Äôll be recapping my hands-on tests with Gemini 3 checkpoints and what the recent Vertex AI listing might mean for the launch. I cover the 2HT, ECPT, and X28 checkpoints, where each one shines or stumbles, pricing expectations, tool-calling, and how I‚Äôm planning the public-preview benchmark the moment it drops.

--
Key Takeaways:

üîé Vertex AI briefly listed ‚ÄúGemini 3.0 Pro (preview)‚Äù with 11-2025, suggesting an imminent launch.  
üß™ Recap of checkpoints: 2HT was excellent, ECPT felt nerfed, and X28 has been the strongest so far.  
üß† Strong reasoning with a slow first token on the best checkpoints hints at a ‚Äúthinking‚Äù variant.  
üéØ Consistency is notably higher than many peers; repeated runs produce similar, coherent outputs.  
üß© Big wins in one-shot code for 3D/Three.js, clean UI, SVG/Blender; Minecraft and Pok√©ball improved; butterfly sim strong but sometimes clips.  
üõ†Ô∏è Tool-calling looks promising in early tests (Roo Human Relay) but needs reliable multi-step chaining; likely trained for Gemini CLI/Jules patterns.  
üí∏ Pricing expectations: Sonnet-level or lower would make it a clear value; above Sonnet needs stronger tool-call reliability and throughput to justify.  
‚öñÔ∏è Benchmarking advice: don‚Äôt judge by ‚ÄúWebOS‚Äù demos; push math, 3D, and multi-file flows; test regeneration stability and latency to first token.  
üö¢ Likely rollout: Pro preview first, Flash near it; ‚ÄúUltra‚Äù label uncertain, but some checkpoints feel Ultra-tier.

videos.title: ByteDance Seed Code (Fully Tested): ANTHROPIC is OFFICIALLY SCARED of this MODEL!
videos.description:
In this video, I break down ByteDance‚Äôs new Doubao Seed Code model that‚Äôs reportedly beating Claude and GPT-5 on coding for a fraction of the cost, why Anthropic cut Trae‚Äôs Claude access, how to try it via ZenMux, and my hands-on non-agentic and agentic benchmark results.

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ Doubao Seed Code (ByteDance) challenges Claude and GPT-5 on coding tasks.  
üí∏ Pricing is insanely low at $0.17 and $1.12 per million tokens.  
üé• Multimodal support: works with images and video inputs.  
üåè China-only via Volcano API; access globally through ZenMux as a workaround.  
üîó ZenMux offers an Anthropic-compatible API to use it with Claude Code.  
üß™ Non-agentic tests: mixed results, with standout wins (Minecraft Kandinsky, Rust CLI).  
üõ†Ô∏è Agentic tests via Claude Code: Go TUI Calculator excelled; others struggled due to tool-calling.  
üìà Leaderboards: ~15th (non-agentic) and ~12th (agentic); speed ~80 tokens/sec.  
üèÜ SWE Bench Verified shows Trae + Doubao topping, possibly prompting Anthropic‚Äôs Trae cutoff.  
‚úÖ Overall: fast, cheap, and promising‚Äîgreat value if you can access it.

videos.title: Gemini CLI 6.0: They JUST ADDED a TON NEW FEATURES for GEMINI-3!
videos.description:
In this video, I‚Äôll walk you through the Gemini CLI upgrades since v0.9.0 (v0.10.0‚Äìv0.12.0) and how the new Jules integration turns it into a scriptable, extension‚Äëpowered platform with smart model routing, workspace awareness, and background coding you can delegate.

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ v0.10.0 polish: more reliable interactive tool calling in TTY, broader Alt+key support, and telemetry diff stats to see model vs. human edits.  
üì° v0.11.0 adds streamable JSON output (use --output-format stream-json), a Markdown toggle (Alt+M/Ctrl+M), queued message editing, proper non‚ÄëHTML fetch handling, and non‚Äëinteractive MCP slash commands.  
üß† v0.12.0 makes model selection first‚Äëclass with /model and smart routing (Flash for quick tasks, Pro for heavy/creative), with pinning for deterministic runs.  
üóÇÔ∏è Codebase Investigator subagent explores your workspace, resolves relevant files, and brings context into the session, with turn limits for guardrails.  
üß© Extensions expand (Hugging Face, Monday.com, Data Commons) with install/list/update flows, /extension explore for the catalog, and configurable compression thresholds.  
ü§ñ Jules integration: a managed VM that clones your repo, installs deps, edits files, and opens a new branch; drive it with /jules prompts and status checks.  
üß™ Practical workflows: export chats with tools (Markdown/JSON), stream JSONL headlessly, show Status In Title, and keep CI‚Äëfriendly, reviewable diffs.  
üëç Overall, Gemini CLI now feels like a serious developer platform with real day‚Äëto‚Äëday wins.

videos.title: 6 LLMs TESTED: GPT-5 v/s Sonnet 4.5 v/s Grok 4 & MORE!
videos.description:
In this video, I walk through Kilo Code‚Äôs practical comparison of six AI models on three real-world code security problems, explaining how each model found the issues, what fixes were shippable, what it cost, and a playbook for using frontier vs budget models in your PR workflow.

--
Key Takeaways:

üîç Six-model, three-problem head-to-head: GPT-5, OpenAI o3, Claude Opus 4.1, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Grok 4, and Gemini 2.5 Pro tested with the same prompt and rubric.  
üß™ Two-phase scoring: AI judge on correctness, quality, completeness, safety, performance, followed by human ‚Äúwould merge‚Äù validation.  
üß∞ Node.js deep-merge/prototype pollution: all caught it; GPT-5 layered null-prototype bases, key bans, own-property guards; o3 close with clean helpers; Sonnet solid; Opus schema-heavy; Gemini missed some recursion; Grok skipped an auth own-property check.  
üß† Agent workflow security: GPT-5 and o3 led with tight tool scopes, output gating, provenance checks, and least-privilege tokens; others had good theory but lighter implementation depth.   
üí∏ Cost: ~$1.81 total across all runs; ImageMagick was costliest; ~$0.60 per evaluation and ~$0.10 per model call on average.  
‚öñÔ∏è Recommendations: For bulk scans, Gemini 2.5 Pro or o3 deliver 90‚Äì95% of GPT-5 quality at 72‚Äì75% lower cost; for money/health/auth paths, pay for GPT-5; Sonnet 4.5 is a strong week-to-week workhorse.  
üß≠ Practical workflow: in CI/PRs, use o3 for maintainable fixes and GPT-5 for hardening; replace shell strings with execFile/spawn; enforce allowlists, own-property checks, schema validation, and tight trust boundaries.  
üìù Results nuance: AI judge crowned GPT-5, but humans shipped o3 for readability and maintenance; pick models by mission, not a single ‚Äúbest.‚Äù  
üöß Limitations: only three problems; ecosystems vary; AI judge isn‚Äôt final‚Äîhuman review matters; newer agent patterns widen quality spread.

Instead of loading all your tools upfront and burning through tokens, the new code execution approach lets Claude interact with MCP servers as code APIs. This means tools load on-demand, data filters in the sandbox before reaching the model, and token usage drops from 150K to 2K.

videos.title: O erro que QUASE TODO MUNDO comete ao criar Agentes IA no WhatsApp
videos.description:
üì± Aul√£o: Criando Agentes de IA: https://alvoleads.com.br/grupo

üìå Curso de Prompt: https://alvoleads.com.br/prompts

üìÇ Templates N8N: https://alvoleads.com.br/templates-n8n/
üì± API de Whatsapp que uso: https://alvoleads.com.br/y-uzapi
‚û°Ô∏è Meu Whatsapp: https://hermesmind.com.br/yt-afonso


--------------------------------------------

Muita gente que come√ßa a trabalhar com Agentes de IA no WhatsApp comete o mesmo erro: acha que basta conectar a OpenAI, o WhatsApp, o Supabase e o Google Sheets para tudo funcionar perfeitamente.

S√≥ que criar um Agente de IA para WhatsApp vai muito al√©m das integra√ß√µes. O verdadeiro diferencial est√° no c√©rebro do agente ‚Äî o prompt. E √© exatamente sobre isso que eu falo neste v√≠deo: o erro que quase todo mundo comete ao criar Agentes IA no WhatsApp, e como evitar que o seu agente se torne mais um rob√¥ gen√©rico que s√≥ responde mensagens.

O prompt √© o cora√ß√£o do agente. Ele √© o respons√°vel por guiar a IA em cada resposta, definir o tom da conversa, o que pode ou n√£o ser dito e como o agente deve reagir em cada situa√ß√£o. S√≥ que a maioria das pessoas cria o prompt correndo, sem estrutura, sem fluxo e sem estrat√©gia. √â a√≠ que surgem os problemas.

A IA come√ßa a responder de forma confusa, repetitiva, ou at√© inventando informa√ß√µes. E o criador acaba achando que o problema est√° no modelo da OpenAI ‚Äî quando, na verdade, o problema √© o prompt mal feito.

No v√≠deo, eu mostro na pr√°tica o impacto de um prompt mal estruturado em qualquer tipo de agente, seja um Agente de IA para agendamento, um Agente de IA para cl√≠nica, ou at√© um Agente de IA que entende √°udio.

O erro √© sempre o mesmo: falta de clareza e de l√≥gica no fluxo de atendimento. Quando a IA n√£o entende o que vem depois, ela se perde e quebra a experi√™ncia do usu√°rio. √â como se um atendente humano come√ßasse uma conversa e, no meio do caminho, esquecesse o que deveria fazer.

Outro erro comum √© o tamanho do prompt. Tem gente que acredita que quanto maior, melhor. Mas um prompt enorme e mal otimizado faz o agente consumir tokens desnecessariamente, aumenta custos e deixa a IA lenta e desatenta. Um bom Agente de IA no N8N precisa de prompts curtos, claros e divididos por blocos estrat√©gicos. No v√≠deo, eu explico como montar esses blocos, como criar uma ordem l√≥gica de atendimento e como definir as regras para cada situa√ß√£o do cliente.

Tamb√©m falo sobre a import√¢ncia de revisar o prompt depois que o agente vai pro ar. Muita gente cria o agente, testa uma vez e nunca mais mexe. Mas o ideal √© analisar as conversas reais, identificar os pontos onde a IA travou, errou ou respondeu mal, e ajustar o prompt com base nisso. Um Agente de IA para WhatsApp n√£o √© est√°tico. Ele precisa evoluir conforme as intera√ß√µes e os comportamentos dos clientes.

Mostro ainda como uso meus pr√≥prios GPTs personalizados para acelerar o processo de cria√ß√£o de prompts profissionais. Esses GPTs me ajudam a estruturar Agentes IA no N8N em alta velocidade, mantendo clareza, consist√™ncia e humaniza√ß√£o nas respostas. Essa metodologia √© a mesma que eu ensino na minha forma√ß√£o pr√°tica, voltada para quem quer aprender de verdade como criar Agentes IA no WhatsApp de forma estrat√©gica e funcional.

Se voc√™ vende automa√ß√µes, trabalha com atendimento digital ou quer ter seu pr√≥prio Agente de IA para agendamento automatizado, esse v√≠deo √© pra voc√™. Nele, eu explico como transformar um fluxo simples em uma opera√ß√£o inteligente, que entende contexto, responde com empatia e se adapta a diferentes tipos de neg√≥cio. Voc√™ vai entender como um bom prompt muda completamente a percep√ß√£o do cliente e eleva o n√≠vel do seu agente.

No fim, a grande li√ß√£o √© simples: n√£o adianta ter a melhor IA ou o melhor fluxo no N8N se o c√©rebro do agente ‚Äî o prompt ‚Äî est√° bagun√ßado. Um Agente de IA que entende √°udio, agenda automaticamente e atende com naturalidade s√≥ existe quando o prompt √© claro, estrat√©gico e testado em situa√ß√µes reais.

Assista ao v√≠deo at√© o final pra entender como criar Agentes IA no WhatsApp do jeito certo, evitar os erros mais comuns e levar seus projetos de Agentes de IA no WhatsApp a um n√≠vel profissional.

videos.title: GPT-5.1 (Caterpillar CKPT Tested): This NEW GPT-5 Checkpoint by OpenAI seems QUITE GOOD!
videos.description:
In this video, I'll be talking about the alleged new OpenAI GPT-5.1 models that have quietly appeared under stealth names like Firefly, Chrysalis, Cicada, and Caterpillar ‚Äî and how they compare to GPT-5, Claude, GLM, and Gemini 3 in real-world tests.

--
Key Takeaways:

ü§ñ Four new alleged GPT-5.1 derivative models ‚Äî Firefly, Chrysalis, Cicada, and Caterpillar ‚Äî are now appearing on Design Arena and LM Arena.  
‚ö° Each model seems to have a different reasoning ‚Äúbudget,‚Äù scaling from 16 to 256 reasoning units.  
üß† Caterpillar performs best among them, but still underperforms compared to Claude and GLM in coding and reasoning benchmarks.  
üéÆ Benchmark testing includes tasks like 3D Minecraft, Chessboard logic, SVG generation, and math reasoning.  
üìâ GPT‚Äë5 Codex seems degraded, possibly signaling new model rollouts or inference optimizations happening behind the scenes.  
üèóÔ∏è OpenAI‚Äôs newer strategy and nonprofit structure raise community concerns about transparency and performance trade‚Äëoffs.  
üåê Meanwhile, competitors like Google, MiniMax, and Z‚ÄëAI are quietly building smarter, smaller, and more reliable ecosystems.  
üìä Overall, GPT‚Äë5.1 (Caterpillar) feels like a modest upgrade ‚Äî decent for reasoning, but not groundbreaking.

videos.title: n8n Gemini 2.5 Pro: The Ultimate OCR Workflow for Invoice Processing

Let's dive into the capabilities of Google's latest, Gemini 2.5 Pro, and test its optical character recognition on a variety of datasets. This review explores how well the Gemini AI model performs with real-world examples and use cases, showcasing its potential as one of the top AI tools for data science. We'll also be testing various AI agent workflows!

videos.title: 4 ChatGPT Hacks that Cut My Workload in Half
videos.description:
Grab HubSpot‚Äôs #ChatGPT ebook: https://clickhubspot.com/4f1519

Most people waste hours going back and forth with ChatGPT, refining prompts until they finally get decent results. This video shows you four techniques that change that completely.

videos.title: How to Use Task Master AI (Real-World Tutorial)
videos.description:
What if your AI coding assistant wasn't just a pair programmer, but a full-on project manager? In this video, I take a deep dive into Task Master AI, a powerful tool for AI project management that aims to solve one of the biggest problems in AI development: context decay.

Unlike other tools, Task Master uses a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server to manage your project's state. This means the AI can query for specific tasks without flooding its context window, allowing it to maintain focus and "remember" the entire plan.

I put it to the test on a real-world project: migrating my 500+ article Astro blog from MDX files to Astro DB. Join me as I go through the full workflow:

- Installation & Setup
- Parsing a Product Requirements Document (PRD)
- The core expand (for task breakdown), next, and update commands
- A major debugging "hiccup" that almost stopped the project
- My professional takeaways on this powerful methodology

Is Task Master the AI project manager you've been missing? Let's find out.

Task Master on GitHub: https://github.com/eyaltoledano/claude-task-master

*Timecodes (Chapters)*

00:00 - Intro
01:03 - Project Overview
01:57 - Installation & Setup
03:04 - Parsing the PRD
03:45 - How Task Master Works (MCP)
04:51 - The Core Workflow
06:15 - My Real-World Experience
08:08 - Hiccup 1: The .env File Mystery
08:31 - Hiccup 2: The Missing CLI
08:36 - Purr-fessional Takeaways
10:01 - Outro

videos.title: Cursor Composer 1 & SWE-1.5 (Fully Tested): LOL, HOW CAN A $10B COMPANY MAKE A MODEL THIS BAD?
videos.description:
In this video, I‚Äôll be talking about Cursor‚Äôs new model called Cursor Composer and Windsurf‚Äôs SWE‚Äë1.5, how both claim to be super‚Äëfast agentic coding models, what they‚Äôre based on, and how they actually perform in real tests.

--
Key Takeaways:

‚ö° Cursor launched ‚ÄúComposer,‚Äù while Windsurf (Cognition) introduced ‚ÄúSWE‚Äë1.5‚Äù ‚Äî both promising extremely fast agentic coding speeds.  
üß† Both models are most likely based on open‚Äëweight models like GLM‚Äë4.6 or Qwen 3 Coder, but neither company gives proper credit.  
üö´ Benchmarks and transparency are missing ‚Äî neither shares details of the true base model or training process.  
üß© Real‚Äëworld testing shows Cursor struggles with apps like Movie Tracker, Svelte, and Nuxt, with many build and logic errors.  
üëé SWE‚Äë1.5 performs even worse, barely completing simple coding tasks and ranking low in performance tests.  
üí¨ Despite big tech backing, both models feel rushed ‚Äî essentially rebranded open models with minimal RL fine‚Äëtuning.  
üí° The video discusses performance comparisons with MiniMax, GLM, Qwen, and other open models that deliver better results.  
üî• In conclusion: speed means nothing if the generated code is poor ‚Äî transparency and model quality matter more.

--
Timestamps:

00:00 - Introduction  
00:08 - About Cursor Composer & SWE 1.5
01:54 - PhotoGenius (Sponsor)
03:11 - Cursor Composer & SWE 1.5 testing
08:57 - Ending

videos.title: Claude code vs Codex vs Cursor: Who gets the cake?
videos.description:
Claude Code changed everything. In this video, we explore what is claude code and how these CLIs like Codex, Gemini, and QwenCode compare, and what Anthropic‚Äôs approach reveals about the future of portable AI engines and OpenAI‚Äôs own CLI strategy.

Links: 

Videos You should Watch: 
Bash Agents (Video): https://youtu.be/1_twhMU9AxM?si=_E5_G0ZBYdw6Ye8rÔøº
Use Claude Code with Other Models (Repo) ‚Äî https://github.com/musistudio/claude-code-routerÔøº

As we break down this shift toward terminal-native AI, we also explore how claude code skills unlock new workflows inside your system, how developers are using claude code vscode integrations for real projects, and where the landscape stands in claude code vs cursor comparisons. We also look at claude code web capabilities, and why the entire industry started moving toward portable coding agents that run anywhere‚Äîincluding servers, CI pipelines, GitHub workflows, and even headless environments.

This video also highlights how codex vs claude code plays out in real usage, especially when using claude code agents for automation or comparing cursor vs claude code in long-context coding tasks. We dive deep into claude code mcp, and why developers are now experimenting with turning Claude Code into a fully portable MCP server. For newcomers looking for budget-friendly tools, we discuss when claude code free options matter and how claude code vs codex compares when running multi-step agentic tasks.

Along the way, we also explain what is claude code from the ground up, covering claude code best practices, chaining tools, sub-task planning, and using claude code subagents to break large projects into smaller, delegated processes. And if you're coding inside editors, we walk through how to use claude code in vscode and the benefits of having claude code in vscode for building, debugging, and shipping faster.

Throughout the video, we tie all of this back to the broader AI ecosystem‚Äîai, chatgpt, ai news, openai, cursor, vibe coding, crash course, ai automation, prompt engineering, coding, artificial intelligence‚Äîand how this new generation of portable AI engines may completely reshape how developers write software.

Hashtags
#ai #chatgpt #ainews #openai #cursor #vibecoding #crashcourse #aiautomation #promptengineering #coding #artificialintelligence

videos.title: Get Started with LangSmith Agent Builder
videos.description:
LangSmith Agent Builder (now in private preview) lets anyone create agents through a text-to-agent experience ‚Äî no coding or prompt engineering required. Just describe what you want in plain language. The system asks follow-up questions, auto-generates your agent's prompt, connects tools via MCP, and sets up triggers for emails, Slack messages, or schedules.

LangSmith Agent Builder is built on our deepagents package with planning capabilities, persistent memory, and multi-step task handling. Its built-in memory learns from corrections. You can also securely connect to tools like Gmail, Slack, and Linear within the agent building flow.

videos.title: NVIDIA Nemotron Nano 2 VL (12B) : This SMALL, LOCAL VLM has GREAT RESULTS
videos.description:
Model weights on HuggingFace - NVIDIA Nemotron Nano 2 VL: https://nvda.ws/4qBVoAQ

In this video, I walk through NVIDIA‚Äôs Nemotron Nano 2 VL‚Äîan open, efficient vision-language model for document intelligence and video understanding‚Äîshowing real demos, setup tips, and how I use it daily (early access, in collaboration with NVIDIA).

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ Nemotron Nano 2 VL is an open, efficient multimodal VLM for OCR, tables, charts, diagrams, and video.  
üß† Hybrid Transformer + Mamba architecture delivers faster, more efficient performance than the last gen.  
üîì Open weights under Apache-2.0, plus an openly available training dataset for reproducible workflows.  
ü•á Best-in-class OCR and chart reasoning in its class, with strong structured extraction.  
üé• Video input support uses efficient frame sampling to keep semantics while cutting token cost.  
üîÑ Hybrid reasoning: toggle deep reasoning vs. quick extraction via ‚Äúslash think‚Äù and ‚Äúslash no think.‚Äù  
üîå OpenAI-compatible API: works with Chatwise, KiloCode, RooCode, Cline, OpenWebUI, and Jan.  
üß∞ Colab notebook demo: point the OpenAI client to NVIDIA‚Äôs endpoint; mix images, video, and text.  
üìä PDF Q&A and receipts summation demos; multi-image YoY analysis that explains its steps.  
üß™ Practical pipeline: LLM-judged evaluations using Playwright screenshots and structured outputs.  
üíª Daily coding: Architect mode, reliable tool-calling, and design summarization workflows.  
‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations: no computer/browser control out of the box; community fine-tunes may explore this.  
üß© 12B parameters; weights on Hugging Face; preview on NVIDIA NIM and Build platforms.  
üíº Great for finance ops, business docs, and on-device-friendly automation.

videos.title: Turn Text Into a Knowledge Graph with 70B LLM on DGX Spark
videos.description:
Looking to run local GraphRAG or other graph analytics use cases? With DGX Spark, you can prepare your local text files for graph use cases at your desk.

In this demo, a Llama-3.1-70B model served by Ollama runs locally in DGX Spark‚Äôs 128GB of unified memory. After uploading local biomedical research papers into the LLM, the model extracts nodes and relationships that are embedded into a knowledge graph. By processing entire documents at once, the knowledge graph retains critical long-range relationships that make GraphRAG and other graph analytics more accurate.

The entire demo runs on DGX Spark, enabling data privacy, security, and avoiding lag time with moving development to a data center. We use ArangoDB‚Äôs graph database to host our knowledge graph and three.js to explore it visually.

videos.title: How I Finally Understood Self-Attention (With PyTorch)
videos.description:
Understand the core mechanism that powers modern AI: self-attention.In this video, I break down self-attention in large language models at three levels: conceptual, process-driven, and implementation in PyTorch. 

Self-attention is the foundation of technologies like ChatGPT and GPT-4, and by the end of this tutorial, you‚Äôll know exactly how it works and why it‚Äôs so powerful.

Key Takeaways:
* High-Level Concept: Self-attention uses sentence context to dynamically update word meanings, mimicking human understanding.
* The Process: Learn how attention scores, weights, and value matrices transform input data into context-enriched embeddings.
* Hands-On Code: See step-by-step how to implement self-attention in PyTorch, including creating embeddings and computing attention weights.

By understanding self-attention, you‚Äôll unlock the key to understanding transformers and large language models.

videos.title: Most devs don‚Äôt understand how context windows work
videos.description:
A deep dive into the context window - the most important constraint when using AI coding agents. Learn what makes up a context window (input and output tokens), why models have limits, and the critical "lost-in-the-middle" problem that causes models to deprioritize information buried in long conversations. Discover practical strategies for managing context effectively in Claude Code, including when to clear vs. compact conversations, why bigger context windows aren't always better, and how MCP servers can bloat your context. Understanding context windows is the key skill that separates developers who get great results from coding agents versus those who struggle. Includes real examples and best practices for maintaining lean, focused contexts that maximize AI coding performance.

videos.title: BMAD vs. Spek Kit vs. Open Spec: Which AI Coding Methodology is Best?
videos.description:
Just typing vague prompts at an AI chatbot, or "vibe-coding," is a dead end for any serious software project. It leads to poor output, lost context, and unmaintainable code.
A new wave of structured AI development **methodologies** is here to fix that. But are they any good?
I decided to find out. I took one project‚Äîbuilding a landing page for The Gray Cat channel with Next.js, Tailwind, and three live API integrations‚Äîand built it three separate times using three competing **approaches**: the heavyweight BMAD method, GitHub‚Äôs Spek Kit, and the fast-moving Open Spec. The results were shocking: one took eight hours, and another took just seven minutes.
In this video, I break down the entire process for all three **approaches**: the setup, the philosophy, the painful, slow parts, and the final results. By the end, you'll know exactly which one is right for your project and which one might be a colossal waste of time.
*[ LINKS ]*
- *BMAD:* [https://github.com/bmad-code-org/BMAD-METHOD](https://github.com/bmad-code-org/BMAD-METHOD)
- *GitHub Spek Kit:* [https://github.com/github/spec-kit](https://github.com/github/spec-kit)
- *OpenSpec:* [https://github.com/Fission-AI/OpenSpec/](https://github.com/Fission-AI/OpenSpec/)

*[ TIMECODES ]*
- 00:00 - Intro: The Problem with "Vibe-Coding"
- 01:10 - The Project & Tech Stack
- 02:09 - Method 1: The BMAD Beast (8 Hours)
- 04:02 - Method 2: GitHub's Spek Kit (Under 2 Hours)
- 05:47 - Method 3: The Open Spec Speedrun (7 Minutes)
- 07:28 - Head-to-Head Comparison
- 08:55 - Conclusion: Which One Should You Use?
- 10:44 - Outro
---
The Gray Cat: Where AI meets code. Your essential guide to building next-generation software with modern AI tooling. Master AI IDEs, structured development, and practical AI app development. Welcome to the future of coding.

videos.title: This is Penpot, the open-source collaborative design platform
videos.description:
Penpot is the open-source design platform for designer and developer collaboration. Discover our manifesto! "Our world is an open canvas, a source of collaboration‚Ä¶"

Now‚Äôs the perfect time to switch to Penpot. 
Variants and tokens have taken a huge leap forward, and a brand-new canvas renderer focused on performance is just around the corner.

Also, a huge shout-out to our Visual Team for crafting this wonderful video using a 100% open-source pipeline.
Big hugs to the amazing open-source tools that made it possible : @BlenderOfficial  @audacity kdenlive and ffmpeg.  

And of course, huge thanks to Caroline Faber for her voice-over that perfectly carries the story!

--
Penpot is the free open-source design tool for Design & Code collaboration. 
https://design.penpot.app‚Äã‚Äã

Penpot is ideal for product design: UI designs, prototypes, wireframes, mockups, webs, apps, and much more.

Penpot allows a true collaboration and no handoff drama between designers and developers thanks to features like CSS Grid Layout, Flex Layout and Code Inspect. 

Designers get a professional, intuitive, powerful design tool with ground-breaking responsive layouts, design systems at scale. While developers get a design tool that expresses as code and provides ready-to-use code to develop faster. 

Penpot is the only one that can be web-based or self-hosted. The app works with open standards (SVG and CSS) avoiding vendor lock-in. Also, it enables teams the flexibility and control in their designs, thanks to the API and webhooks available.

videos.title: Create Diagrams and infographics with ChatGPT in Seconds! New ChatGPT Apps!
videos.description:
Create Diagrams and Infographics with ChatGPT in Seconds! New ChatGPT Apps!
In this video, we explore how the new ChatGPT Apps feature lets you create diagrams, flowcharts, concept maps, and infographics instantly without leaving the chat. 
You‚Äôll see how ChatGPT connects directly to Figma and Canva to design professional visuals in real time. From generating structured content to customising layouts, colours, and text everything happens inside ChatGPT.

We‚Äôll walk through three quick examples: 
‚úÖ A flowchart 
‚úÖ A concept map 
‚úÖ An infographic

By the end, you‚Äôll know exactly how to turn ideas into visuals ‚Äî fast, editable, and ready to share. 
Prompts from this video: 
Flowchart Prompts
Prompt 1
Create the steps for a decision flowchart that supports decision-making for a patient‚Äôs diagnosis. Your task is to: Identify and describe the key stages and decision points that typically occur during a patient diagnosis process, starting from the patient presenting symptoms through to treatment initiation. 
Present the flow in a clear sequence with short, action-based labels. Include at least two decision points with logical ‚ÄúYes/No‚Äù outcomes. 
Add visual design instructions for how it should appear when drawn as a flowchart: ‚ÄÉ
‚Ä¢ Use ovals for Start and End ‚ÄÉ
‚Ä¢ Use rectangles for process steps ‚ÄÉ
‚Ä¢ Use diamonds for decision points ‚ÄÉ
‚Ä¢ Use soft pastel colours (light blue, mint green, peach) for each shape type 
‚Ä¢ Keep the layout linear from top to bottom 
Output the full result in structured text format so it‚Äôs ready to be turned into a flowchart in Figma. 

Prompt 2 (for ChatGPT to create it in Figma): 
Connect to Figma app and create the above 

Concept Map Prompts Prompt 1
 Prompt 1 (for ChatGPT to generate the structure): 
Create the structured content for a colourful concept map titled ‚ÄúAI in Global Health Systems.‚Äù Use seven main branches connected to the central node: Diagnostics, Predictive Analytics, Remote Monitoring, Telehealth, Precision Medicine, Drug Discovery, and Ethical Oversight. 
For each branch, include 2‚Äì3 short bullet points describing key applications or impacts. Add colour labels or themes for each branch (for example, blue for Diagnostics, green for Predictive Analytics, etc.). 
Then describe how the clusters are interconnected, showing data flow and relationships ‚Äî for instance, how Predictive Analytics supports Diagnostics, or how Remote Monitoring feeds into Precision Medicine. 
Keep the structure clear and visually ready for mapping in Figma (with clear node titles, sub-points, and connection notes). 

Prompt 2 
Connect to Figma app and create the above 

Infographic Prompts 

Prompt 1 
Create the content for a visually engaging infographic titled ‚ÄúThe Evolution of Artificial Intelligence: Key Milestones Through Time.‚Äù The infographic should present a timeline of AI development that moves through distinct eras, each represented with a unique colour and short milestone descriptions. The design should be clear, balanced, and visually appealing, with illustrated icons and concise text. 
Prompt 2 
Connect to Canva app and create the above

videos.title: ChatGPT Atlas: Is This the Smartest Browser Ever?
videos.description:
# ChatGPT Atlas Browser: Complete Guide to OpenAI's AI-Powered Browser

Discover ChatGPT Atlas, the revolutionary browser with built-in AI capabilities from OpenAI. This comprehensive walkthrough demonstrates how Atlas transforms your browsing experience with integrated ChatGPT features that understand context, automate tasks, and enhance productivity.

## What You'll Learn:

**Core Features Overview:**
Experience a browser that goes beyond traditional browsing with AI assistance at every step. Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly into your workflow, understanding the context of pages you visit and providing intelligent assistance without leaving your browser.

**Smart Context Awareness:**
See how Atlas automatically understands webpage content and answers questions based on what you're viewing. Whether you're reading news articles, browsing GitHub profiles, or managing emails, the AI knows exactly what you're looking at.

**Email Composition Assistant:**
Watch how Atlas can compose and enhance emails directly from Gmail. Transform simple messages into detailed, professional communications with key points automatically researched and added from the web.

**Browser Memory & Tab Management:**
Learn how to ask Atlas to recall and reopen tabs from your browsing history. Simply describe what you were looking at last week, and the AI will surface those pages instantly.

**Agent Mode - Automated Shopping:**
Experience the groundbreaking cursor feature where AI takes control to automatically select items, add them to your cart, and create a finalized shopping list. Perfect for planning trips or gathering specific products without manual clicking.

**GitHub Integration:**
See real demonstrations of analyzing GitHub profiles, calculating contributions over 12 months, generating visual charts, and reviewing code issues - all within the browser interface.

**Excel Automation:**
Discover how Agent Mode can categorize data, fill in empty cells, and add formulas automatically. Watch as AI handles repetitive spreadsheet tasks that would normally require manual work.

**Gmail Enhancement:**
Learn techniques for selecting text in emails and asking Atlas to make it more detailed, professional, or add researched key points automatically by searching relevant websites.

**Search Capabilities:**
Explore the enhanced search experience with AI-powered summaries from multiple websites, organized into categories like normal search, images, videos, and news - all with intelligent context.

**Setup & Interface:**
Complete walkthrough of downloading, installing, and configuring Atlas for MacOS. Tour of the dark mode interface, settings panel, and how it compares to Google Chrome's familiar layout.

**Developer Tools:**
For developers, see how to access inspect element, console, sources, network tab, and Lighthouse analysis - maintaining all the functionality you expect from modern browsers.

**Privacy Features:**
Learn about the incognito mode that doesn't save history or link to your ChatGPT account, ensuring your browsing remains private when needed.

**Extension Compatibility:**
Discover that Atlas supports Chrome extensions, allowing you to install and use your favorite tools seamlessly.

**Practical Demonstrations:**
Multiple real-world examples including website analysis, browsing history retrieval, data visualization, travel shopping automation, expense categorization, and professional email writing.

# Key Timestamps

0:00 - Introduction to ChatGPT Atlas Browser
0:54 - Download, Installation & Interface Tour
1:19 - Basic Search & AI News Summary Feature
1:57 - Browsing History Retrieval & Tab Management
3:16 - GitHub Profile Analysis & Chart Generation
4:33 - Gmail Email Composition & Enhancement
5:46 - Agent Mode: Automated Shopping Demo
7:00 - Agent Mode: Excel Data Categorisation & Formulas
8:35 - Settings, Extensions & Developer Tools Overview

**Keywords:** ChatGPT Atlas, AI browser, OpenAI browser, ChatGPT browser, AI-powered browsing, automated shopping, agent mode, browser automation, Gmail AI assistant, GitHub analysis, Excel automation, intelligent browsing, context-aware AI, browser memory, tab management, developer tools

#ChatGPT #AIBrowser #OpenAI #Atlas #Productivity #Automation #ArtificialIntelligence #TechReview #BrowserTutorial #AITools 


Explore the new ChatGPT Atlas, a browser with integrated **chat gpt** capabilities by OpenAI. This **browser ai agent** can answer questions based on the web page you're viewing, offering contextual assistance. Discover how it can help compose emails and reopen past tabs, showcasing the power of **ai tools** and **ai agents** in your browsing experience. Get started with this **chatgpt tutorial** and discover **chatgpt browsing** today!

videos.title: Road to NODES | Build Your First Knowledge Graph AI Agent with Neo4j MCP
videos.description:
This hands-on workshop shows you how to build smarter AI agents: ones that don‚Äôt lose context. You‚Äôll use Neo4j‚Äôs Model Context Protocol (MCP) to give your agents persistent, graph-based memory, allowing for richer, multi-turn interactions and intelligent behavior grounded in your data.

You‚Äôll walk through the full agent-building process: from setting up a knowledge graph, to integrating GraphRAG for multi-hop reasoning, and deploying an agent with contextual memory that evolves over time. By the end of the session, you‚Äôll have a working, production-ready AI agent you can extend for your own use cases.

You will learn:
- How to use Neo4j MCP to persist context across interactions
- How to build and query a knowledge graph for intelligent agents
- How to implement GraphRAG for contextual, multi-hop retrieval
- How to deploy and optimize your AI agent for real-world use

Register for all workshops: https://neo4j.registration.goldcast.io/series/0acbef0b-15ad-42da-a066-804dc620b44d

videos.title: Gemini CLI 5.0 (New Upgrades): Get Ready for Gemini 3! New Code Sub-Agents, Shell Options!
videos.description:
Visit PhotoGenius AI: https://www.photogenius.ai/

In this video, I‚Äôll walk you through Gemini CLI v0.9.0‚Äôs new interactive shell and the experimental Codebase Investigator agent, with a hands-on demo, install steps, and real-world caveats.

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ v0.9.0‚Äôs interactive shell runs full TUIs inside Gemini CLI (vim, nvim, nano, htop/top, interactive git rebase -i, REPLs, npm init, ng new) with no context switching.
üß† Under the hood: PTY via node-pty streams terminal state (text, colors, cursor), supports two-way input, proper SIGWINCH on resize, and improved color rendering.
‚å®Ô∏è A focus shortcut lets you lock into the terminal session to work without model chatter for uninterrupted edits and commands.
üõ†Ô∏è Quick setup: enabled by default in v0.9.0; update with `npm install -g @google/gemini-cli@latest` or try the preview via `npm install -g @google/gemini-cli@preview`, then verify with `gemini --version`.
üìä The Codebase Investigator (testing) analyzes repos, maps architecture and hotspots, and proposes coherent multi-file changes with diffs, approvals, checkpoints, and rollbacks.
‚ö†Ô∏è Honest caveats: platform-specific key combos can vary; deep TUIs and huge monorepos may stress buffers; some diffs need human review; ecosystem is moving to MCP servers/agent-mode; quotas differ by auth (Pro/Ultra higher limits).
üëç Big picture: fewer janky transitions, two-way interactivity, and scalable, controlled refactors‚Äîall from the CLI.

--

Key Takeaways:

‚öôÔ∏è Onboarding covers sign-in, optional data import, Memories opt-in, and default-browser setup.
üîí Privacy tip: Disable ‚ÄúImprove model for everyone‚Äù in Data Control to prevent training on your data.
üí¨ Do chat, file uploads, image generation, and speech-to-speech; chat over any webpage for summaries.
üß≠ Cleaner search UI with tabs (Images, Videos, etc.) using GPT-5 with search for quick answers.
ü§ñ Two modes: general chat and an agentic mode; agent mode is slow, Pro-only, and not recommended.
üß∞ Missing vs Dia: Skills/slash commands, system prompt customization, and multi-profile browsing.
‚úèÔ∏è Inline edits/email help are rolling out but not available to everyone yet.
üéõÔ∏è UI is slick and very similar to Dia; Comet underwhelmed in testing.
‚úÖ Verdict: Fine for quick assistance, but Dia remains better for speed, customization, and power features.

videos.title: SORA 2 e VEO 3.1 tem NOVIDADES INSANAS
Get Started with Insights Agent in LangSmith
videos.description:
Today's popular agents produce millions of traces per day‚Äîsoon to be billions. These traces contain valuable signal about an agent's capabilities and how real users engage with it. If you could review each interaction, you would gain deep insight into how to improve your agent. Manual review is time-consuming and impossible at scale, so how can we automate this insight generation process?

Insights Agent is our first step towards helping LangSmith users find signal in their production traces. Insights Agent analyzes traces to discover and surface common usage patterns, agent behaviors, and failure modes. 

In agent engineering, you need to iterate rapidly to build reliable experiences. This new feature helps you figure out where to focus your next set of tests based on real interactions your agent is having.

Learn more: https://bit.ly/4qlw15V

Get started with LangSmith: https://bit.ly/43vKzGj

videos.title: I Built an Entire App with OpenAI's Codex and 8 AI Agent Employees
videos.description:
Go to https://startup-ideas-pod.link/idea-browser to get validated startup ideas every single day and prompts to build your big idea

Launch Pricing goes up October 24th. Lock in your price

Join me as I chat with Alex Finn about going from no idea to building a functional app using AI tools. We use Idea Browser to find trending business opportunities, develop a wellness habit tracking app concept with ChatGPT, and build it using Codex's AI agents. The episode showcases how one person can leverage AI to find and build an idea into a product.

Get the blueprint to go from idea to an app in one afternoon: https://startup-ideas-pod.link/ai-builder

Timestamps:
00:00 - Introduction and overview 
00:39 - Finding app ideas with Idea Browser 
05:19 - Using ChatGPT to develop the app concept 
17:36 - Overview of Codex and its capabilities 
22:25 - Building the MVP while spinning up multiple AI agents
46:04 - Marketing strategy for launching the app

Key Points:
‚Ä¢ Using Idea Browser to find validated business ideas by analyzing trends and market insights from social platforms
‚Ä¢ Leveraging ChatGPT to develop a business concept into a detailed Product Requirements Document (PRD) 
‚Ä¢ Building an app with OpenAI's Codex using both local and cloud agents simultaneously 
‚Ä¢ Implementing a marketing strategy through organic social media outreach

1) Finding Validated Ideas with Idea Browser

The #1 challenge for builders today isn't coding‚Äîit's coming up with GOOD IDEAS.

Alex shows how Idea Browser helps by:
‚Ä¢ Mining Facebook groups & Reddit for pain points
‚Ä¢ Identifying trending opportunities
‚Ä¢ Showing solution gaps in the market

"Ideas are the lifeblood of business" - Greg

2) The Idea Selection Process

When choosing an idea to build, look for these three criteria:

‚Ä¢ Growing industry (check the trend data)
‚Ä¢ Low competition (easier entry)
‚Ä¢ Something YOU personally understand/love

This triple-threat approach ensures you're building something with actual potential AND you'll enjoy working on it!

3) Developing Your Idea with AI

Once you've found a promising trend (they chose "wellness app"), use this workflow:

‚Ä¢ Copy the trend data from Idea Browser
‚Ä¢ Paste into ChatGPT with a specialized prompt
‚Ä¢ Have AI generate multiple specific app concepts
‚Ä¢ Refine until you have something you'd actually use

They landed on "Habit Flow" - a wellness habit tracker that adapts to your energy levels!

4) Creating a Product Requirements Document (PRD)

BEFORE writing a single line of code, have AI create a detailed PRD.

This is the SECRET SAUCE most people miss! AI agents work MUCH better when given a comprehensive plan.

The PRD includes:
‚Ä¢ Core features
‚Ä¢ User flows
‚Ä¢ Technical requirements
‚Ä¢ Monetization strategy

5) The Power of Codex Cloud Agents

This is where things get WILD. With OpenAI's Codex, you can:

‚Ä¢Run multiple AI agents SIMULTANEOUSLY
‚Ä¢ Work locally AND in the cloud
‚Ä¢ Access your projects from any device (mobile, browser, IDE)

While one agent builds your app, others can work on marketing, roadmaps, and more!

6) The "AI Employee" Mindset

The GAME-CHANGING approach Alex uses:

"I challenge myself to spin up 3 tasks for AI agents before bed every night so when I wake up, my app has advanced."

This isn't just coding‚Äîit's running a one-person company with 8 AI employees working 24/7!

7) Debugging Made Simple

Forget complex workflows for debugging. Alex's method:

1. Copy the error
2. Paste it to Codex
3. Ask it to fix it

No need for fancy setups or complex MCPs‚Äîsimple is often better!

8) From MVP to Users

Once your MVP is built, start gathering users through organic marketing:

‚Ä¢Tweet about the problem your app solves
‚Ä¢ DM interested people with beta access
‚Ä¢ Gather feedback and iterate


The #1 tool to find startup ideas/trends - https://www.ideabrowser.com/

videos.title: Claude 4.5 Haiku (Fully Tested): The WORST Model Anthropic has ever made! Scores #34 on KingBench
videos.description:
In this video, I break down Anthropic‚Äôs new Claude 4.5 Haiku, run real-world coding and agentic tests, and explain why it falls behind Claude Sonnet 4, GPT-5 Mini, and GLM-4.6 in performance, reliability, and value.

--
Key Takeaways:

üö® Anthropic positions Claude 4.5 Haiku as a small, fast model with Sonnet-level coding claims.  
üß™ Hands-on tests show weak outputs: incoherent floor plan, poor SVG panda layout, underwhelming ThreeJS Pokeball and chessboard, and a weak web Minecraft demo.  
üß© The butterfly scene is fine, but the CLI tool and Blender script failed to run.  
üìä Scores 34th and 37th on my charts; repeated runs (5+ times) confirm poor raw performance.  
ü§ñ Agentic runs via Claude Code: Movie Tracker 404, Go terminal calculator errors, Godot build failures, and weak results across OpenCode, Svelte, Nuxt, and Tauri.  
‚ö†Ô∏è Not a true drop-in replacement for Sonnet 4 in practical coding despite ‚Äúreasoning model‚Äù branding.  
üí∏ Value check: GLM-4.6 outperforms at lower cost; Haiku 4.5 charges more for less.  
üß≠ Model lineup context: Anthropic (Opus/Sonnet/Haiku) vs OpenAI (GPT-5/Mini/Nano); Anthropic lacks a Nano-tier.  
üè¢ Observation: seems optimized for enterprise benchmarks over developer experience.  
üîß Recommendation: use GLM-4.6, GPT-5 Mini, or Grok Code Fast; if you want to try Haiku 4.5, KiloCode offers $25 free credits.

videos.title: Regulation D (SEC)
videos.description:
In the United States under the Securities Act of 1933, any offer to sell securities must either be registered with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) or meet certain qualifications to exempt them from such registration. Regulation D (or Reg D) contains the rules providing exemptions from the registration requirements, allowing some companies to offer and sell their securities without having to register the securities with the SEC. A Regulation D offering is intended to make access to the capital markets possible for small companies that could not otherwise bear the costs of a normal SEC registration. Reg D may also refer to an investment strategy, mostly associated with hedge funds, based upon the same regulation. The regulation is found under Title 17 of the Code of Federal Regulations, part 230, Sections 501 through 508. The legal citation is 17 C.F.R. ¬ß230.501 et seq.
On July 10th, 2013, the SEC issued new final regulations allowing public advertising and solicitation of Regulation D offers to accredited investors. 


This video is targeted to blind users.

Attribution:
Article text available under CC-BY-SA
Creative Commons image source in video

videos.title: Build live voice agents that listen, reason, and respond, using Google‚Äôs ADK
videos.description:
Learn more: https://bit.ly/43jxboy

In "Building Live Voice Agents with Google‚Äôs ADK" you'll learn from Lavi Nigam and Sita Lakshmi Sangameswaran, Machine Learning Engineers at Google. 

You‚Äôll learn how to build and deploy AI agents with Google‚Äôs open source Agent Development Kit (ADK). ADK provides modular components such as models, tools, memory, and orchestration, that make it easier to create both simple and complex systems.

You‚Äôll start by building a voice agent that takes speech input, reasons with an LLM, and responds with voice output. Then you‚Äôll work with sessions, state, and memory, and extend your agents with tools and APIs to perform real-world tasks.

Next, you‚Äôll add callbacks and guardrails for reliability and orchestrate specialized agents like planners and researchers. You‚Äôll build a podcast agent that researches a topic, drafts a conversational script, and produces multi-speaker audio with Gemini text-to-speech models. Then, you‚Äôll build in guardrails to secure and optimize your agents before reviewing methods for deploying them into production. 

In detail, you‚Äôll: 

- Build your first agent with ADK, connect it to Google Search, and test live voice interactions in the ADK Web UI.
- Use sessions, state, and memory to manage conversations, share context between tools, and give agents short-term tracking and long-term recall across interactions.
- Add custom tools and API, integrate them with ADK, and refine agent instructions so they follow defined workflows effectively.
- Generate structured research reports by defining schemas, rewriting agent instructions to act as a coordinator, and saving results as markdown files for downstream use.
- Add guardrails with callbacks to filter unsafe sources, enforce rules, and log tool activity, making your agents safer, more predictable, and production-ready.
- Build a podcast agent by combining schemas, callbacks, and a dedicated audio agent, and generate multi-speaker episodes with Gemini text-to-speech in a scalable workflow.
- Learn how to productionize your agents by giving them persistent memory, testing their reliability, deploying on Vertex AI, and adding security and monitoring for safe scaling.

Enroll now: https://bit.ly/43jxboy

‚Ä¢ Genspark features an AI calling agent that can make phone calls on your behalf and transcribe conversations
‚Ä¢ The platform integrates with various tools through MCP (Messaging Communication Protocol) connections to Gmail, Calendar, and other services

1) Multi-Agent Workflows: The GAME-CHANGER

Tired of LLM ping-pong? Genspark lets you prompt ONCE and get answers from multiple AI models:

‚Ä¢ Chat: Pings GPT-5, Claude Sonnet, Gemini 2.5 simultaneously

2) AI Image Multi-Agents

‚Ä¢ Generate variations across MULTIPLE image models

3) Video Generation That Actually Works

Turn any image into cinematic video with:

‚Ä¢ Multiple video models (VO3, C-Dance Lite, Minimax)
‚Ä¢ Audio generation on some models
‚Ä¢ Customizable aspect ratios and durations

And all this for ~$20/month vs. the hundreds you'd spend on Manus!

4) AI Slides: From Idea to Deck in Minutes

Perfect for founders and marketers:

‚Ä¢ Choose from templates (minimalist, corporate, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Paste your idea and get a complete deck
‚Ä¢ Auto-generates competitive analysis, market sizing, financials
