videos.title: Context Engineering for AI Agents with LangChain and Manus
videos.description:
Join us for a deep dive into context engineering ‚Äì the critical practice that determines how well your AI agents perform in production. Lance Martin from LangChain and Manus co-founder Yichao "Peak" Ji share battle-tested strategies for managing context windows, optimizing performance, and building agents that scale. Peak was recently named one of MIT's Innovators Under 35 for his work on AI agents. Here, we cover Manus's context engineering approach. Strategies include: (1) **Context reduction** via dual-form tool results (full/compact) with policy-based compaction and schema-driven summarization; (2) **Context offloading** through layered action spaces (function calling ‚Üí sandbox utils ‚Üí packages/APIs) with filesystem-based state management and shell utilities instead of vectorstore indexing; (3) **Context isolation** using minimal sub-agents (planner, knowledge manager, executor) with agent-as-tool paradigm and constrained decoding for schema-based inter-agent communication.

üìä Access the Presentations:

Lance Martin's slides (LangChain): https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16aaXLu40GugY-kOpqDU4e-S0hD1FmHcNyF0rRRnb1OU/edit?slide=id.p#slide=id.p 

Yichao "Peak" Ji's slides (Manus): https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QGJ-BrdiTGslS71sYH4OJoidsry3Ps9g/view?usp=sharing

Ready to start building reliable agents? 
Sign up for LangSmith, our agent observability & evals platform: https://www.langchain.com/langsmith/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=youtube&utm_campaign=q4-2025_meetup-manus_co

Chapters
0:01:00 Introduction to context engineering
0:12:00 Why context engineering in Manus
0:15:00 Context reduction in Manus
0:19:20 Context isolation in Manus
0:22:17 Context offloading in Manus
0:29:00 Avoid context over-engineering
0:31:00 Q&A: Explain sandbox utils in Manus
0:31:55 Q&A: Indexing (vectorstore) vs just using files
0:32:50 Q&A: Memory in Manus
0:34:30 Q&A: Manus and The Bitter Lesson

videos.title: Master Postgres Full-text Search in 5 Minutes
videos.description:
Postgres has a set of built-in features that enable full-text search efficiently. We walk you through various functions and features that enable you to bring it to your apps!

Learn more about full-text search in Postgres: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/full-text-search

In this video, you will learn what tsvector and tsquery are, and how they are used to find relevant search results. Then we will cover how to search across multiple columns, and how to add weight to different columns so that, for example, we could prioritize the title column over the description column. Also, covering how to rank various search results so that more relevant results will come at the top. Lastly, we will bring all those features to supabase-js using a database function.

00:20 Setting up the scene
00:47 What is tsvector
01:20 Search across multiple columns
01:51 tsquery deep dive

videos.title: Taskmaster 3.0 + GLM-4.6 : This is the BETTER WAY to do SPEC-DRIVEN Development right now!
videos.description:
In this video, I break down spec-driven AI coding (SpecKit/OpenSpec), explain why it‚Äôs not ideal for production, and show a developer-first alternative: Taskmaster MCP for PRD-driven, multi-stage planning that integrates with Claude Code, OpenRouter, Kilo, and CLI workflows.

--
Key Takeaways:

üß© What spec-driven AI coding is and why auto-generated specs often fall short for production.  
üß≠ How relying on tools like SpecKit/OpenSpec without domain knowledge (e.g., Expo vs Flutter) leads to weak choices.  
ü§ñ Why I prefer agents/models that one-shot smaller tasks cleanly over sprawling ‚Äúdo-everything‚Äù plans.  
üóÇÔ∏è Taskmaster MCP workflow: generates a PRD, parses it into tasks/subtasks, and feeds a focused to-do list to your coder.  
üîå Simple setup: paste the MCP config, add Anthropic/Perplexity keys or OpenRouter‚Äîworks seamlessly with Claude Code.  
‚è±Ô∏è Usually 2‚Äì3 MCP calls to scaffold plans; can research unfamiliar libraries and newer tech as needed.  
üß† Plays well with GLM via multi-stage planning for more reliable results than single-shot plans.  
üñ•Ô∏è Integrates with Kilo; if you want lean context, you can also use a Terminal/CLI instead of MCP.  
üéØ Built for devs who want to accelerate their own workflow‚Äînot ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù‚Äîand ship production-ready apps.  
üé¨ Example use case: movie tracker app (TMDB API, Auth0) plus a benchmark UI plan.

videos.title: My AI Videos Hit 1M+ Views (Veo3 + Sora 2 Demo)
videos.description:
Get the Blueprint to Build Your AI Video Agency: https://startup-ideas-pod.link/AI-Video-Agency

Join me as I chat with PJ Ace from Genre AI as he breaks down his comprehensive process for creating viral AI videos that have garnered millions of views for clients like David Beckham and Origin Financial. He demonstrates how to use a combination of AI tools to script, generate images, animate characters, and edit professional-looking commercials. The conversation also explores how emerging technologies like Sora will transform the industry while emphasizing that great creative ideas will remain the most valuable asset.

Timestamps:
00:00 - Intro
04:47 - AI Video Process Overview
06:54 - Script Writing Process
12:36 -  ChatGPT for Shot List Creation
13:39 - Reve AI for Storyboarding 
20:39 -Veo3 for Video Generation
27:28 - Editing and final production
28:08 - Final Tips and Tricks
34:37 - Sora's impact on the AI video production workflow

Key Points:
‚Ä¢ PJ shares his complete process for creating viral AI videos that has helped scale his agency to six and seven figures in months 
‚Ä¢ The workflow involves scripting, creating shot lists with ChatGPT, generating images with Rev, animating with VO3, and final editing 
‚Ä¢ Using recognizable IP, juxtapositions, and internet-native content helps videos gain traction and views 
‚Ä¢ PJ discusses how OpenAI's Sora may disrupt current workflows but believes creative ideas will remain the most valuable asset

1) The End-to-End AI Video Creation Process
PJ's agency scaled to 7-figures in MONTHS using this workflow:
‚Ä¢ Script ‚Üí ChatGPT shot list ‚Üí Figma board ‚Üí Image generation ‚Üí VO3 animation ‚Üí Final edit
The key? Start with COMEDY. People laugh = less AI pushback + higher engagement.

2) The Script is Everything
For viral AI ads, PJ recommends:
‚Ä¢ Use recognizable IP (Pompeii, Titanic, Marie Antoinette)
‚Ä¢ Create juxtapositions that make people lean forward
‚Ä¢ End with internet-native references (meme coins, NFTs)

3)  Image-First Approach over Direct Text-to-Video
GAME-CHANGER: Don't generate videos directly from text!
Instead:
‚Ä¢ Take script to ChatGPT
‚Ä¢ Generate detailed image prompts for each scene
‚Ä¢ Create multiple image variations using Rev app (https://app.reve.com/)
‚Ä¢ Iterate conversationally: "Make this a close-up" or "Add more dock workers"

4) The Reve App Secret Weapon
‚Ä¢ Gives 3 variations of every prompt
‚Ä¢ Allows conversational iteration
‚Ä¢ Creates PHOTOREALISTIC characters
‚Ä¢ Maintains consistency across scenes
Even non-filmmakers can create professional-looking shots without understanding camera angles.

5) VO3 Animation: Making Characters Talk
Once you have your perfect images:
‚Ä¢ Upload your image to VO3 as a starting frame
‚Ä¢ Add your dialogue prompt
‚Ä¢ Let VO3 animate the talking and movements

6) Advanced Hacks for Better Results
PJ's secret sauce:
‚Ä¢ Include reference images WITHIN your upload to guide VO3
‚Ä¢ For example: Hide Beanie Babies in your image so VO3 knows what to reveal
‚Ä¢ Use picture-in-picture to show what you want the camera to pan to
‚Ä¢ Always use FAST mode in Google Flow (80% quality at fraction of cost)
These tricks create impossible-to-create moments that look REAL.

7) The Editing & Tools Breakdown
For final assembly:
‚Ä¢ CapCut (free, simple)
‚Ä¢ DaVinci Resolve (free, intermediate)
‚Ä¢ Premiere ($19/mo, professional)
‚Ä¢ Final Cut (one-time purchase, Mac only)

8) The Sora Disruption
PJ admits: "Sora will disrupt our existing workflow."
Soon Sora will:
‚Ä¢ Auto-generate scripts
‚Ä¢ Create images AND videos
‚Ä¢ Add sound effects and music
‚Ä¢ Extend beyond 10-second clips

videos.title: Building a Text to SQL Agent for handling complex database queries | LangChain | Python
videos.description:
This video is an in-depth tutorial on building a Text-to-SQL Agent using LangChain in Python. 

In this video, we'll go beyond simple queries and show you how to create a powerful AI agent that can understand complex, natural language questions and convert them into accurate SQL. You'll learn to handle everything from simple SELECT statements to advanced joins and subqueries.

What You'll Learn:

1. Building the Agent: We'll walk you through setting up a LangChain agent from scratch, giving it the "tools" it needs to interact with a database.

2. Converting Text to SQL: Discover how to leverage an LLM (Large Language Model) to dynamically write robust SQL queries from plain English.

3. Handling Complex Queries: See a live demonstration of the agent tackling questions that require joining multiple tables and performing aggregations.

Codebase: https://github.com/SauravP97/AI-Engineering-101/tree/main/text-to-sql

videos.title: Text-to-SQL is dead: The next generation of querying is Agentic
videos.description:
This paper (https://arxiv.org/abs/2502.00032) introduces a type of agentic querying called Function Calling that uses an LLM to structure queries using predefined function calls in JSON format, with optional arguments for search, filters, aggregation, and grouping. 

Along with that, it also tests out a bunch of different models with a new dataset, DBGorilla, designed to evaluate agentic querying techniques on real-world use cases.

Weaviate also just released a Query Agent, designed based on some of the work in this paper, to handle advanced agentic querying out of the box, find out more here: https://weaviate.io/blog/query-agent

videos.title: RAG and SQL Queries: How AI Handles Complex Structured Data
videos.description:
Structured data poses unique challenges, but RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) has the solution.

In this video, we explore how RAG handles structured data effectively by integrating fusion retrievers, SQL queries, and multi-agent systems. Whether it‚Äôs answering questions based on tabular data or generating precise SQL queries, RAG delivers actionable insights with ease.

What you‚Äôll learn:
‚òëÔ∏è Fusion Retrieval: How RAG splits retrieval into agents for vector databases, graph databases, and structured SQL databases.
‚òëÔ∏è SQL Query Generation: How an agent converts user queries into SQL statements, retrieves the data, and passes it to the LLM for context generation.
‚òëÔ∏è Handling Structured Data: Why RAG is perfect for answering complex, table-based questions like ‚ÄúHow many loans above $10,000 have been given since Jan 1, 2024?‚Äù
‚òëÔ∏è Seamless Integration: How RAG integrates structured and unstructured data to provide accurate, comprehensive answers.

Imagine asking, ‚ÄúHow many loans above $10,000 have been given since Jan 1, 2024?‚Äù RAG dynamically generates an SQL query, retrieves the exact data from the database, and seamlessly integrates it with other retrieved contexts for a complete, accurate answer.

This video is perfect for developers, businesses, and AI enthusiasts who want to understand how to handle structured data challenges with RAG and SQL integration.

videos.title: GPT-5 Codex + GLM-4.6 : This MULTI-AGENT CODING Setup IS 3X CHEAPER & 2X BETTER than Claude Code!
videos.description:
In this video, I‚Äôll share how I pair GLM-4.6 with GPT-5 Codex to get reliable planning and debugging in Kilo, work around flaky reasoning traces in tools like Cline and Roo, set up Architect/Code/Debug modes, and keep costs low while improving performance.

--
GLM Coding Plan (affiliate link - not sponsored): https://z.ai/subscribe?ic=NWKPDIY9WD

--
Key Takeaways:

üß† GLM-4.6 is great overall but can be finicky with debugging and long reasoning plans.  
üß© Tools like Cline, Roo, Kilo, and Claude Code don‚Äôt fully support reasoning traces yet.  
üõ†Ô∏è Kilo is my workflow hub: Architect for planning, Code for changes, Debug for fixes.  
üìÑ Use GPT-5 Codex in Architect mode to draft plans and save them as markdown.  
üîÅ GLM-4.6 in Architect mode can often match GPT-5 Codex once the plan is dialed in.  
üêû For bigger bugs, switch to GPT-5 Codex; it debugs better, especially with logs.  
‚öôÔ∏è Set default models per mode in Kilo to reduce errors and speed up context switching.  
ü§ñ Orchestrator mode can automate flows (Codex as orchestrator, GLM for Code), if you prefer hands-off.  
üí∏ The combo costs me about $20/month and yields a 20‚Äì30% performance boost, more on complex repos.  
üîÑ If you don‚Äôt want Kilo, you can use the Codex ChatGPT plan UI; limits are usually enough.  
üÜö Many tools are tuned for Claude, which can skew perceptions‚ÄîGLM and Codex are underrated.  
‚úÖ Overall, this setup is practical, faster, and more reliable than using Sonnet alone.

videos.title: OpenAI Agent Builder vs Claude: Who Wins Multi-Agent Workflows? (Complete Comparison)
videos.description:
OpenAI Agent Builder unlocks the full AI ecosystem. From building agents with OpenAI Agent Builder to customizing interfaces through OpenAI Chat Kit, this update shows how easily developers can create, deploy, and sell intelligent apps powered by the OpenAI Agent Kit.


Links: 
The ChatKit App: https://github.com/openai/openai-chatkit-starter-app

1) The Three Major Updates from OpenAI Dev Day

OpenAI just released three groundbreaking tools that change how AI is built and deployed:

‚Ä¢ Agent Builder: Visual workflow creator for multi-agent systems
‚Ä¢ ChatKit: SDK to embed chatbots into websites or apps
‚Ä¢ Widgets: Dynamic UI components for chat interfaces

These updates drastically lower the barrier for non-technical users to build advanced AI workflows without needing to code.

‚∏ª

2) Agent Builder: Multi-Agent Workflows Made Visual

Before: Developers had to write custom code for agent orchestration.
Now: The OpenAI Agent Builder offers a drag-and-drop visual interface that allows you to:

‚Ä¢ Create sequential or parallel workflows
‚Ä¢ Connect agents to vector stores for context
‚Ä¢ Add conditions and logic-based branches
‚Ä¢ Implement safety guardrails and controls

As Amir explained, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs essentially reducing the barrier for non-technical people to get started with multi-agent workflows.‚Äù

‚∏ª

3) How Agent Builder Actually Works

Each workflow in the OpenAI Agent Builder consists of connected ‚Äúnodes‚Äù representing actions. These can include:

‚Ä¢ Starting with user input
‚Ä¢ Adding classifier agents for intent recognition
‚Ä¢ Branching logic based on user type
‚Ä¢ Connecting to specialized agents for unique tasks
‚Ä¢ Integrating tools and vector stores for data context

The power lies in specialization ‚Äî each agent performs one task exceptionally well, creating a modular and scalable workflow.

‚∏ª

4) The Demo: A Smart Customer Support Bot

In the official demo, Amir built a customer support bot that:
 1. Classifies whether the user is a lead or existing customer
 2. Provides support via knowledge bases for customers
 3. Collects lead information for sales follow-up

All of this was done without writing any code. The bot even integrates with CRMs and Slack using MCPs (Model Context Protocols).

‚∏ª

5) ChatKit: Embedding Your Agents Anywhere

Once your workflow is ready, ChatKit allows you to:

‚Ä¢ Retrieve the workflow ID from Agent Builder
‚Ä¢ Embed the agent directly into your website or app
‚Ä¢ Customize the chatbot‚Äôs appearance and functionality
‚Ä¢ Deploy it instantly without relying on developers

This enables product, marketing, and support teams to use AI interactively across digital platforms.

‚∏ª

6) Why This Matters for Non-Technical Teams

The biggest advantage is accessibility.
As Greg said, ‚ÄúThe CLI is daunting for people‚Ä¶ computers didn‚Äôt hit mainstream adoption until there was a graphical user interface on top.‚Äù

Now, with Agent Builder and ChatKit, OpenAI has removed the terminal and command-line barrier, offering a visual way for teams to build and deploy intelligent workflows.

‚∏ª

7) How This Compares to Claude

‚Ä¢ OpenAI is catching up in visual workflow building tools
‚Ä¢ Claude still leads with MCPs, having pioneered the protocol
‚Ä¢ OpenAI‚Äôs next step will be expanding its MCP directory to match this ecosystem

Both platforms are shaping the future of multi-agent orchestration and AI automation.

‚∏ª

8) Getting Started with Agent Builder

To start building effective workflows in OpenAI Agent Builder:
 1. Clearly define your use case
 2. Map the workflow logic visually
 3. Prepare relevant vector store data
 4. Use minimal context for optimal performance
 5. Define each agent‚Äôs role precisely
 6. Add external tools or MCPs where needed

This structured approach ensures your workflows stay efficient, modular, and scalable.

‚∏ª

9) Key Opportunities for Founders
 1. Use ChatGPT apps as a discovery and distribution channel
 2. Introduce Agent Builder to non-technical teams across departments
 3. Empower product managers, support, and sales teams with visual tools
 4. Let engineers focus on MCP integrations and server-side setups

These releases open massive opportunities for companies to democratize AI creation.

‚∏ª

#openaiagentbuilder #ai #chatgpt #ainews #openai #aiagents #aiagent #aiautomation #artificialintelligence #aitools

videos.title: I Watched Dan Koe Break Down His AI Workflow OMG
videos.description:
Get the exact blueprint to Build A Content Engine Like Dan Koe (Prompts Included):¬†https://startup-ideas-pod.link/content-engine

Join me as I chat with Dan Koe where he shares his content creation system that allows him to efficiently produce high-quality content across multiple platforms. He explains how he uses Twitter as a testing ground for ideas, then repurposes successful content for newsletters, YouTube videos, and other social platforms. Dan demonstrates how he uses AI tools to research topics, generate content ideas, and analyze successful content structures without sacrificing his unique voice and perspective.

Timestamps:
00:00 - Intro
02:09 - Overview of AI Content Engine
04:45 - How Dan generates newsletter ideas
10:32 - Using Twitter as a litmus test for content ideas
14:19 - Tools Dan uses to find viral content
16:32 - Dan‚Äôs AI Workflow and Prompts
21:01 - Daily content creation routine
26:06 - Discussion about visual assets in content
32:20 - Creating Viral Content with AI (Prompt Breakdown)

*Dan uses SuperX. Link: https://superx.so/?via=community

Key Points:
‚Ä¢ Dan uses a systematic approach to content creation, starting with Twitter posts to validate ideas before expanding to other platforms
‚Ä¢ He leverages AI tools (primarily Claude and ChatGPT) to research, summarize, and generate content ideas
‚Ä¢ His weekly workflow includes writing newsletters that become YouTube videos, and creating 2-3 social media posts daily
‚Ä¢ Dan uses specific AI prompts to analyze high-performing content and create frameworks for replicating successful formats

1) The Content Ecosystem Framework

Dan's entire content machine runs on just TWO core activities:
‚Ä¢ ONE weekly newsletter (sometimes twice)
‚Ä¢ 2-3 social media posts DAILY

He writes for Twitter FIRST (280 char limit) then repurposes EVERYWHERE:
‚Ä¢ Threads
‚Ä¢ Instagram
‚Ä¢ LinkedIn
‚Ä¢ YouTube scripts
‚Ä¢ Reels/TikTok

2) The Newsletter Research Hack

Dan doesn't spend hours taking notes from research. Instead:

‚Ä¢ Finds YouTube videos on his topic
‚Ä¢ Uses Gemini 2.5 to summarize HOURS of content into digestible notes
‚Ä¢ Has AI compare with his previous content to find connections
‚Ä¢ Creates an outline from these insights

This turns 6+ hours of research into 1000 focused words!

3) The Idea Validation System

How does Dan know what to write about? Two brilliant approaches:

1. Use Twitter as a testing ground - when a tweet performs well, expand it into a newsletter
2. Study what ALREADY works - find top-performing YouTube videos in your niche, take the TOPIC (not the content), add your unique perspective

4) The AI Content Multiplier

After writing his newsletter, Dan runs it through THREE custom prompts:

‚Ä¢ YouTube title generator (creates 20-30 titles based on his best performers)
‚Ä¢ Deep post generator (extracts paradoxes, quotes, transformation arcs)
‚Ä¢ Content ideas generator (60 ideas based on his top-performing formats)

5) The Daily Content Routine

Dan's productivity system is SHOCKINGLY simple:

‚Ä¢ 2 hours of focused writing each morning
‚Ä¢ Must complete one newsletter section
‚Ä¢ Must write three social posts
‚Ä¢ Schedule everything across platforms

That's it. Two hours daily = millions of followers across platforms.

6) The Follower Growth Formula
1. Experiment until you find a post type that generates followers
2. Create consistent "spin-offs" of that format (30% of content)
3. Use remaining 70% to experiment for the NEXT winning format
4. Cycle out older formats as new ones emerge

7) The AI Post Deconstruction Technique
1. Find posts you admire
2. Ask AI: "Break down the structure of this post so I can recreate it"
3. Do this for 3 different posts
4. Have AI combine them into a "complete guide"
5. Ask what context it needs from YOU
6. Create a custom prompt that interviews you then writes in that style

8) The Prompt Engineering Secret

Dan uses a "prompt that helps create better prompts" approach:
- First, get AI to break down what makes great content work
- Then, create a two-phase prompt:
    - Phase 1: Interview you for context
    - Phase 2: Generate content based on your answer

The combination of Claude Code's CLI capabilities with the flexibility of an SDK creates a unique development experience. You get enterprise-grade AI automation that's fully customizable and can be embedded directly into your applications.

videos.title: Steal this Prompt Framework to Build Apps with AI 10X Faster
videos.description:
üöÄ Join my community to start building your app idea with AI today @ https://www.skool.com/aiapps/about
üìù Try App Canvas today at https://appcanvas.io

Most people say you should start with a PRD before you build your app with Lovable, Bolt or any other tool. I actually think this can be detrimental to what you're trying to create, and I want to break down my alternative prompt framework and explain why.

PRDs can often over-explain the technology and set up of your app, and often confuse the AI by prompting it to build something it actually doesn't know how to create.

What you'll see a lot of vibe-coders doing instead, and the prompt framework I recommend is much simpler, and is broken down into 4 parts. In this video, I break down why it works and how to start using this framework today to build apps faster, with better code, so that you can launch and start growing your app without worrying about 25 page PRD documents.

videos.description:
Discover how AI transforms UI editing with Drawbridge - the open-source tool that batch-fixes all your interface issues at once. Works with Claude Code and Cursor for revolutionary ai coding workflows. Better than Figma to Cursor, this visual editor is like Codex CLI but for UI fixes.

In this tutorial, I demonstrate how AI agents handle multiple UI fixes simultaneously through Drawbridge's innovative task queue system. Unlike traditional prompt engineering where you fix errors one by one, this tool revolutionizes coding by letting artificial intelligence process batches of changes efficiently.
The video covers how Cursor AI sometimes struggles with file detection (as I discovered during testing), while Claude performs flawlessly with the same workflow. This comparison shows why choosing the right AI automation tool matters for your development process.

Two game-changing use cases for AI agents:
1. Landing Page Builder - Non-technical users can vibe coding by selecting sections and describing what they want. The AI agent builds each component based on your specifications, perfect for rapid prototyping without complex prompt engineering.
2. Client Collaboration - Transform how clients provide feedback by letting them visually select elements and queue changes. Your AI handles the implementation, streamlining the revision process through intelligent automation.

I also show how to integrate design systems for consistent styling, making your artificial intelligence assistant follow specific design languages. This approach to coding with AI eliminates the back-and-forth typically required when fixing multiple UI issues.
Whether you're using Cursor or Claude Code, this visual approach to AI automation changes everything. The tool's ability to track element positions means your prompts don't need complex descriptions - the AI knows exactly what you're referencing.
Perfect for developers tired of repetitive prompt engineering and anyone looking to streamline their AI coding workflow.

videos.title: Official Chrome MCP Beats Playwright (More Tools & Less Tokens)
videos.description:
Google just released the OFFICIAL Chrome Dev Tools MCP Server - a complete replacement for Playwright MCP that uses LESS context and requires NO browser extension! 

In this video, I'll show you exactly how to set up and use Chrome's official MCP server for web automation, debugging, and performance testing.

‚ö° Pro users see fewer downgrades to Flash during peak times vs. the free tier.

I walk through how I use the new ChatGPT Pulse feature on my phone and what it actually does. ChatGPT Pulse starts the conversation for you, instead of you having to type first. 

It shows a daily update called "Today‚Äôs Pulse" based on your chat history, memories, and any topics you told it to focus on. I show how it pulls up reminders, follow-ups, or even dinner ideas, all based on your past chats. If you connect Gmail or Google Calendar, it can give even more helpful updates. Right now, Pulse is only for Pro users on the mobile app, and I demo exactly how it works on my account.

üëÄ For vision, switch to GLM 4.5 Vision (cheap multimodal) or use Gemini 2.5 Flash to transcribe screenshots.

videos.title: Apps make $50K/mo like THIS (I shouldn't share this)
videos.description:
Join me as I chat with Cody Schneider where we dive deep into how brands can leverage short-form content creators instead of traditional influencers to achieve better marketing ROI. He breaks down the economics of creator partnerships ($900/month for daily content across platforms vs. $2,000 for a single influencer post) and demonstrates how the for-you-page algorithm allows creators with zero followers to potentially reach massive audiences. The strategy works particularly well for mobile apps, e-commerce products, and services with straightforward value propositions.

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
01:26 - Why Short-Form Marketing?
02:55 - Creator vs. Influencer Marketing Explained
04:41 - Micro-Creator Strategy Overview
11:43 - Case study of Focus Tree app using creator marketing
16:04 - How to Find and Work with Creators
19:49 - The Drawbacks of this Strategy
20:27 - Tools for Managing and Tracking Campaign Performance
22:56 - Final Thoughts and Conclusions

Key Points:
‚Ä¢ Creator marketing is more cost-effective than traditional influencer marketing, especially for mobile apps and B2C products 
‚Ä¢ For-you-page algorithms have changed how content reaches audiences, making follower count less important than content quality 
‚Ä¢ Working with multiple creators (5-10) creates a compound learning effect where successful formats can be shared across the team 
‚Ä¢ This strategy works best for products with simple value propositions that can be purchased impulsively on mobile devices

1) Creators vs. Influencers: The New Marketing Paradigm

The social media landscape has COMPLETELY changed:
‚Ä¢ TikTok revolutionized content distribution with the For You Page
‚Ä¢ Content now reaches users based on INTEREST, not followers
‚Ä¢ ALL platforms (Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn) now use this model

This creates a MASSIVE opportunity for brands willing to adapt.

2) The Math That Makes It Work

Let's compare:
‚Ä¢ Influencer with 100K followers: $2,000 for ONE post (30K views)
‚Ä¢ Creator with 0 followers: $900/month for 30 posts (potentially 500K+ views)

The creator strategy gives you:
‚Ä¢ More content
‚Ä¢ More learning opportunities
‚Ä¢ $1.80 CPM vs. $6+ on Facebook

This is pure marketing ARBITRAGE! 

3) Why This Works Better Than Traditional Ads

The secret sauce:

‚Ä¢ Content feels NATIVE to the platform (not like an ad)
‚Ä¢ Algorithm distributes based on engagement, not follower count
‚Ä¢ One viral hit can reach MILLIONS (and you only need 1 in 10 to hit)
‚Ä¢ Viewers trust creators who consistently talk about topics vs. one-off influencer posts

"Organic always works better than paid" - Greg

4) The Compound Learning Effect

The REAL power comes from working with 5-10 creators simultaneously:

‚Ä¢ Each creator posts daily across platforms
‚Ä¢ When one video hits, share those learnings with ALL creators
‚Ä¢ Creates a growth flywheel with constant optimization
‚Ä¢ Best-performing content can be turned into paid ads

This is how apps like Focus Tree scaled to 2M+ users!

5) How To Execute This Strategy

Step-by-step playbook:

1. Find creators already making content in your niche
2. Offer $900/month for daily content (dedicated brand account)
3. Track performance using ShortomizeApp or ViralApp
4. Find viral formats using Virlo or SandcastlesAI
5. Share winning formats across your creator team

6) Which Companies This Works Best For

This strategy SHINES for:

‚Ä¢ Mobile apps with one killer feature
‚Ä¢ B2C products with simple value props
‚Ä¢ E-commerce items under $50
‚Ä¢ Impulse purchases that can happen on a phone

7) The Hidden Benefit: Branded Search

Beyond direct conversions, this strategy creates MASSIVE digital gravity:

‚Ä¢ Videos going viral on TikTok increase Google searches for your brand
‚Ä¢ E-commerce brands see Amazon search spikes after TikTok hits
‚Ä¢ Creates mental real estate in your category

8) Tools You Need To Succeed

The tech stack that makes this possible:

‚Ä¢ Stormy AI - Find and reach out to creators
‚Ä¢ Discord/WhatsApp - Manage your creator team
‚Ä¢ ShortomizeApp / ViralApp - Track campaign performance
‚Ä¢ Virulo/SandcastlesAI - Discover viral content formats

The #1 tool to find startup ideas/trends - https://www.ideabrowser.com/

LCA helps Fortune 500s and fast-growing startups build their future - from Warner Music to Fortnite to Dropbox. We turn 'what if' into reality with AI, apps, and next-gen products https://latecheckout.agency/

--
Key Takeaways:

üöÄ GPT-5 Codex is faster, more capable for agentic coding tasks, and uses ~90% fewer tokens.
üß© It‚Äôs integrated across Codex CLI, Codex Web, and a lean VS Code extension.
‚öôÔ∏è Setup is simple; you can enable it and start using it with a quick command.
üí≥ ChatGPT plan limits vary (about 30‚Äì150 msgs/5h; Pro ~300‚Äì1500), which feels inconsistent.
üé¨ Movie Tracker (TMDB, Expo) demo was decent but missing a details page; design is subjective.
üßÆ Terminal visual calculator (Go + Bubble Tea) was excellent while consuming very few tokens.
üéÆ Godot (GDScript) support is still weak‚Äîsyntax mistakes and Python-like code issues.
üß± Multi-file repo edit (SVG modal in OpenCode) failed; Codebuff passes but at a higher token cost.
üèÜ Overall, it ranks just below Codebuff and slightly ahead of Claude Code for me.
üîå Hoping for API access to pair with RooCode/Cline; Codex VS Code is light but Roo is still stronger.

--

00:24 - What is GPT-5 Codex, Integration, Pricing
01:29 - NinjaChat (Sponsor)
02:18 - Testing & Comparison of GPT-5 Codex with Claude Code
08:01 - Ending

videos.title: OpenAI Solved Hallucination? Insane AI News!
videos.description:
üö® Why do AIs like ChatGPT and Claude make stuff up? A new research paper ‚Äî ‚ÄúWhy Language Models Hallucinate‚Äù ‚Äî explains the real reason hallucinations happen. And it‚Äôs surprisingly simple: models are trained and tested to always guess, even when they don‚Äôt know.

In this video, I‚Äôll break down:
What hallucinations are and why they matter
The ‚Äúguessing student‚Äù analogy from the paper
A live demo of an AI hallucination in action
Why benchmarks and leaderboards make the problem worse
Real-world cases of hallucinations in law, healthcare, and news
How we can fix this by rewarding honesty and uncertainty
This isn‚Äôt just an academic issue ‚Äî hallucinations are already causing problems in real life. But if we change how we evaluate AI, we might finally get systems that know when to stay quiet instead of making things up.

videos.title: Getting Started: Composio Platform using Python
videos.description:
This video is a quick-start guide on how to build a simple Gmail agent using Composio tools and an AI agent in Python.

The guide covers setting up your virtual environment and installing the Composio SDK and OpenAI. It also explains how to configure authentication by creating an Auth Config on the Composio platform and a connected account for your user.

You'll see how to give your agent access to the Gmail toolkit, specifically the GMAIL_SEND_EMAIL tool. The video demonstrates using the handle_tool_calls method to manage tool calls within the user's context. The demonstration concludes with the agent successfully sending an email after the user authenticates.

videos.title: Microsoft's VS Code AI Toolkit 2.0: This Extenstion is AWESOME for AI Coding! (w/ FREE GPT-5!)
videos.description:
Visit NinjaChat: https://ninjachat.ai/

In this video, I'll be In this video, I‚Äôll walk you through the new upgrades to Microsoft‚Äôs AI Toolkit for VS Code‚Äîcovering the new Agent Builder with MCP integration, Bulk Run and Model Evaluation, fine-tuning and tracing, plus how to use local models via Ollama/ONNX and free GitHub Models like GPT-4.1 and GPT-5 right inside VS Code.

--
Key Takeaways:

üß† New Agent Builder lets you create custom AI agents with system prompts, variables, and tool access.  
üîå MCP integration allows agents to use MCP servers and tools for tasks like web scraping or code execution.  
üß™ Bulk Run executes batch prompt tests across multiple models simultaneously for quick comparisons.  
üìà Model Evaluation builds datasets with questions and expected answers, scores similarity, and tracks accuracy.  
üõ†Ô∏è Fine-tune models directly from VS Code in just a few clicks for tailored performance.  
üîç Tracing collects and visualizes trace data to understand model behavior and performance.  
üß∞ Playground supports images, documents, code attachments, and web search with adjustable inference parameters.  
üìÑ Handy Add/Copy buttons and a Get Code option generate files and OpenAI SDK snippets for faster workflows.  
üåê Multiple runtimes supported: Ollama, ONNX, Azure AI Foundry, and OpenAI-compatible APIs.  
‚ö° Runs local models without heavy system prompts, keeping responses fast and lightweight.

--

In this video, I‚Äôll walk you through ClaudeButler which is GitButler‚Äôs new Agents feature‚Äîa graphical Claude Code workflow with sessions-as-branches, worktrees, templates, model switching, and streamlined Git operations, all in an open-source app.

--
Key Takeaways:

üß† Agents bring Claude Code into a clean GUI with parallel sessions mapped to branches.  
üåø Seamless Git workflow: unstaged changes, diffs, commits, operations history, and rollbacks.  
üß© Templates let you save reusable prompts via the GitButler config (Bug Fix, Review, Refactor, Tests).  
üõ†Ô∏è Flexible settings: auto-approve, auto-commit after completion, notifications, and custom Claude path.  
üß™ Model switching: Sonnet 1 Million, Sonnet, Opus, and GLM via local Claude Code integration.  
üñ•Ô∏è Great UX: per-file diffs, line changes, ‚ÄúGo to Workspace,‚Äù and open session branch in VS Code.  
‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations: no ‚Äúapprove all,‚Äù no multiple sessions within one branch, auto-approve toggle is buried.  
‚úÖ Open source and a more professional alternative to tools like Conductor for Git-centric work.  

--

videos.title: Claude Code is RUG PULLING Users! Switch to this OPENSOURCE Alternative NOW!
videos.description:
Visit NinjaChat: https://ninjachat.ai/

Visit ByteRover: https://byterover.dev/?source=ack8

In this video, I break down the recent Claude degradation issues, why subscription models feel unreliable right now, and the best API-first alternatives like OpenCode, GLM Coding Plan, KiloCode, and more to keep your coding workflow stable and cost‚Äëeffective.

--
Key Takeaways:

üö® Anthropic acknowledged degraded outputs for Sonnet 4 and Haiku 3.5; I explain why I think the impact was broader and tied to inference changes.  
üí∏ Subscriptions can be fragile; API access via Vertex/Bedrock (through Requesty) proved more reliable for me than Claude Subscription.  
üîÑ Strategy: use open-source tools and swap providers, not tools‚Äîswitching providers is much easier than rebuilding your stack.  
üß∞ Alternatives: GLM Coding Plan ($3) supports coders like Roo, OpenCode, KiloCode, and Cline; monitor performance as usage grows.  
üß™ Other options: Chutes ($10) for many models, plus Cerebras Code with a fast Qwen 3 Coder‚Äîchoose based on your tasks and latency needs.  
üõ†Ô∏è OpenCode vs Crush: OpenCode is more mature and consistent; Crush can feel faster but tends to underperform on longer tasks.  
‚öôÔ∏è OpenCode features: sub-agents, IDE extension, Claude Code compatibility, and easy provider setup (GLM, Claude Max, etc.).  
üß† MCP servers I use: Context7 for documentation fetching, and ByteRover as a memory layer with Git-style history and team sharing.  
üñ•Ô∏è Prefer a GUI? KiloCode is a solid VS Code option that uses APIs without OpenRouter markup fees.  
üÜì Free tools like Qwen Code and Gemini CLI are great, but rate limits and policy changes mean you can still get rug-pulled.  
‚úÖ Big takeaway: go API-first, stay flexible, and avoid locking into any single subscription.

--
Timestamps:

00:00 - Introduction  
00:07 - What went wrong with Claude (degradation, bugs, timelines)  
03:07 - API-first approach and provider switching strategy  
04:49 - NinjaChat (Sponsor)
05:38 - OpenCode vs Crush
06:33 - OpenCode setup, features, and provider compatibility  
07:48 - ByteRover (AI Memory)  
08:31 - KiloCode VS Code extension and OpenRouter fee notes  
08:56 - Ending

‚Ä¢ Audio Upgrades: four new podcast-style formats (Deep Dive, Brief, Critique, Debate) plus Interactive Mode where you can join the conversation.

videos.title: AI Agents Are Overhyped (Here's Why)
videos.description:
Join My Community to Level Up ‚û° https://www.skool.com/earlyaidopters/about

üìÖ Book a Meeting with Our Team: https://bit.ly/3Ml5AKW

üåê Visit Our Website: https://bit.ly/4cD9jhG

üé¨ Core Video Description

‚ÄúMore agents‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean ‚Äúmore intelligent.‚Äù In this practical ~14-minute breakdown, I show why stacking AI agents across a customer support workflow often creates fragile, expensive systems that implode at scale. You‚Äôll see how reliability compounds downward as you add agents (75% reliable alone can become ~10% reliable in an eight-agent chain), why provider outages and model mismatches trigger hidden retries and ballooning token costs, and how to design for stability first‚Äîusing deterministic automation with surgical AI where it actually helps.

We‚Äôll tour an over-engineered ‚Äúagent army‚Äù (triage, routing, QA, follow-up, billing, knowledge) and contrast it with a boring-but-beautiful 3-node alternative (Webhook ‚Üí AWS Lambda ‚Üí Respond). I‚Äôll walk through cost/risk math, model fallbacks (Claude ‚Üí Gemini), and how to instrument evaluations so you can measure misfires, retries, and dollar impact. By the end, you‚Äôll know exactly where to place AI (drafting, tagging, low-risk steps), when to keep a human-in-the-loop, and how to scale like a smart startup: hire agents only when you‚Äôve hit the limits of simple automation.

‚è≥ TIMESTAMPS:
00:00 ‚Äì Cold Open: The myth of ‚Äúmore agents = smarter‚Äù
00:36 ‚Äì Why complex agent chains fail in production
01:00 ‚Äì Lessons from real deployments (misfires & terminal failures)
02:00 ‚Äì Tour of the over-agented support workflow
02:44 ‚Äì Slot-machine analogy: cascading failures across nodes
03:41 ‚Äì Meet the 6 agents: triage, routing, QA, follow-up, billing, knowledge
04:49 ‚Äì Reliability math: 1‚Üí2‚Üí4‚Üí8 agents and compounding risk
05:36 ‚Äì Provider outages & model fallback pitfalls (Claude, Gemini, prompts)
06:41 ‚Äì Boring beats flashy: deterministic first, AI sprinkles second
07:28 ‚Äì Hiring analogy: add agents like employees, only when needed
08:41 ‚Äì Cost model demo: GPT-5 Nano token mix & per-ticket costs
09:37 ‚Äì Retries and evaluations: how ‚Äúworking‚Äù flows still burn cash
10:02 ‚Äì The 3-node alternative: Webhook ‚Üí AWS Lambda ‚Üí Respond
11:00 ‚Äì Why Lambda consolidates logic (and helps debugging & cost)
11:39 ‚Äì Rule of thumb: build ‚Äúdumb automation‚Äù before agents
12:01 ‚Äì Safe placements for AI: tagging & draft replies (low-risk zones)
12:40 ‚Äì Human-in-the-loop and surgical AI insertions
13:01 ‚Äì Instrumentation: track misfires, retries, and spend with evals
13:22 ‚Äì Maintenance reality: model drift, deprecations, prompt changes
13:58 ‚Äì Takeaway: choose boring, choose profitable + CTA

videos.title: Agentic RAG: An End-to-End Open Source Framework
videos.description:
Elysia is Weaviate's new open source, agentic RAG framework that goes way beyond simple text-in, text-out chatbots. It dynamically displays data, learns from user feedback, and chunks documents on-demand. Built with pure Python logic and DSPy, it's designed to be the next evolution beyond traditional RAG pipelines.

What it does:
‚Ä¢ Uses decision trees to choose the right tools and display formats
‚Ä¢ Analyzes your data structure to understand what you're working with
‚Ä¢ Learns from user feedback to improve responses over time
‚Ä¢ Provides transparency into its decision-making process
‚Ä¢ Works as both a full-featured web app and Python library

The system connects to Weaviate Cloud instances and automatically generates search filters and parameters from natural language queries. Installation is simple with `pip install elysia-ai` .

GitHub: https://github.com/weaviate/elysia

videos.title: SideKick & DeepWiki + CC,Cline,Roo: This Simple Tool Fixes ALL My Context Issues!
videos.description:
Visit MicroSaaSFast: https://www.microsaasfast.me/?utm_aik=1

Visit ByteRover: https://www.byterover.dev/?source=ack5

In this video, I‚Äôll walk you through Sidekick, a free, open-source tool that uses DeepWiki to auto-generate high-quality markdown context files for coding agents, with setup, a live demo on the ShadCN UI repo, performance gains, and comparisons to Context7 and Git MCP.

--
Key Takeaways:

üß∞ Sidekick is open-source with a free hosted option and requires no API keys.  
üß† It uses DeepWiki by Devin (via the DeepWiki MCP) to produce detailed markdown ‚Äúrule/context‚Äù files.  
üìö Works with public GitHub repos and includes clear instructions on where to place the files.  
‚ö° Prefers static markdown/context files over live MCP runs, making agents faster and more reliable.  
üìà Can boost coding agent performance by roughly 10‚Äì30%, especially on larger repos.  
üñ•Ô∏è You can run it locally for privacy; the hosted demo can be spotty due to DeepWiki rate limits.  
ü§ñ Demo shows selecting Cline (or all coders) and downloading optimized markdowns as a zip.  
üÜö Compares Sidekick‚Äôs LLM summaries to Context7‚Äôs pattern matching and Git MCP‚Äôs server approach.  
üóíÔ∏è DeepWiki MCP can chat/summarize repos and generate example snippets for better guidance.  
‚ö†Ô∏è Limitation: Hosted flow targets public repos; private repo support may depend on local setup.

--

videos.title: LangChain Academy New Course: Deep Research with LangGraph
videos.description:
Deep research agents are taking off ‚Äì from major AI labs to companies building their own. 

Research is inherently open-ended. You can't always predict whether a question needs broad exploration or deep analysis. Agents excel here because they adapt on the fly, using each finding to decide where to dig next.

Building these systems ourselves and with customers, we've learned that structure matters. The best research agents scope problems with users first. Then, they coordinate multiple specialists instead of overwhelming one generalist.

LangGraph is built for these types of long-running, multi-agent workflows. Its persistence layer tracks progress across agents. LangSmith gives you the observability and evaluation tools you need to track and improve performance.

In this course, you'll build and evaluate:
- A user scoping agent to define research parameters
- A multi-agent research team with supervisor
- Tool integration via MCP 

Take the course: https://academy.langchain.com/courses/deep-research-with-langgraph/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=youtube&utm_campaign=q3-2025_deep-research-course_co

Learn more about LangGraph: https://www.langchain.com/langgraph/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=youtube&utm_campaign=q3-2025_deep-research-course_co

Learn more about LangSmith: https://www.langchain.com/langsmith/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=youtube&utm_campaign=q3-2025_deep-research-course_co

videos.title: What are Deep Agents?
videos.description:
Using an LLM to call tools in a loop is the simplest form of an agent. This architecture, however, can yield agents that are ‚Äúshallow‚Äù and fail to plan and act over longer, more complex tasks. Applications like ‚ÄúDeep Research‚Äù, ‚ÄúManus‚Äù, and ‚ÄúClaude Code‚Äù have gotten around this limitation by implementing a combination of four things: a planning tool, sub agents, access to a file system, and a detailed prompt. 

Deep Agents are agents that use these four things to execute on longer time horizon tasks.

Blog: https://blog.langchain.com/deep-agents/
GitHub: https://github.com/hwchase17/deepagents

videos.title: Trace your AI Agents for FREE!  (LangTrace)
videos.description:
# üöÄ Master AI Agent Observability with Langtrace - FREE Open Source Tool for LangChain, LlamaIndex & CrewAI

Langtrace is an open-source **data observability** tool that allows you to monitor your **agentic ai** applications in **real-time analytics**. With Langtrace, you can track the performance of your **llm applications** and optimize your **developer productivity**. Understanding the behind-the-scenes interactions is key to improving your AI application.

https://mer.vin/2025/07/langtrace/
http://langtrace.ai/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7RdEyRsatw 

Unlock the power of AI agent monitoring with Langtrace - a completely open-source observability tool that lets you track, optimize, and understand exactly what's happening behind the scenes in your AI applications!

## üìå What You'll Learn

In this comprehensive tutorial, I'll show you how to:
- Install and run Langtrace locally on your computer for FREE
- Monitor AI agent interactions, performance metrics, and costs in real-time
- Integrate Langtrace with popular frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, CrewAI)
- Track API calls, embeddings, and retrieval processes step-by-step
- Optimize slow functions and reduce operational costs
- Set up human evaluation, dataset creation, and prompts registry

## üîß Key Features Covered

**Langtrace Dashboard Overview:**
- Real-time monitoring at localhost:3000
- Track interaction times and identify performance bottlenecks
- Monitor total costs for running AI applications
- Access human evaluation tools
- Manage dataset creation and prompts registry
- Configure settings for your specific needs

**Multiple Integration Support:**
- Ollama
- Autogen
- Gemini
- And many more!

## üíª Installation Guide

**Prerequisites:**
- Docker Desktop (download from docker.com)
- Git installed on your system
- OpenAI API key

**Quick Setup Steps:**
1. Clone the Langtrace repository
2. Navigate to the langtrace folder
3. Run Docker Compose to start the application
4. Access the dashboard at localhost:3000
5. Login with admin credentials (found in .env file)

## üîó Integration Examples

**LangChain Integration:**
- Simple RAG application demonstration
- Document retrieval from soccer rules example
- Track embedding creation and retrieval processes
- Monitor question-answering workflows

**LlamaIndex Integration:**
- Document loading tracking
- Embedding creation monitoring
- Retrieval process visualization
- Step-by-step API call analysis

**CrewAI Integration:**
- Seamless integration with just 2 lines of code
- Complete agent interaction tracking
- Performance metrics for multi-agent systems

## üéØ Why Langtrace?

Without proper observability tools, optimizing AI applications becomes a guessing game. Langtrace provides:
- Complete transparency into AI agent operations
- Cost tracking for budget management
- Performance optimization insights
- Easy debugging capabilities
- Free local deployment option

## üõ†Ô∏è Technical Implementation

Adding Langtrace to your AI application is incredibly simple:
- Install the Langtrace Python SDK
- Add just 2 lines of import code
- Generate and configure your API key
- Start tracking immediately!

## üìä What Gets Tracked?

- Every API call and its duration
- Embedding generation processes
- Document retrieval operations
- Total costs per operation
- Complete interaction traces
- Performance bottlenecks

## üåü Benefits for Developers

- Identify and optimize slow functions
- Reduce operational costs
- Debug complex AI workflows
- Improve application performance
- Gain insights into agent behavior
- Create better AI applications

## üîê Security & Privacy

- Run entirely on your local machine
- Control your own data
- Customize user access and permissions
- Modify passwords and settings as needed

## üìö Resources & Links

All code examples, installation commands, and additional resources are available in the links below. Check out my other video on creating RAG applications for a deeper dive into AI development!

---

üé• If you found this tutorial helpful, don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell for more AI development content!

üí¨ Let me know in the comments what you think about Langtrace and how you're planning to use it in your AI projects!

#Langtrace #AIAgents #LangChain #LlamaIndex #CrewAI #AIObservability #OpenSource #AIMonitoring #MachineLearning #AIOptimization

videos.title: How to apply context engineering
videos.description:
Agents need context (e.g., instructions, external knowledge, tool feedback) to perform tasks. Context engineering is the art and science of filling the context window with just the right information at each step of an agent‚Äôs trajectory. There are many context engineering approaches, and Drew Breunig recently summarized six of the most common in his recent blog post titled "How To Fix Your Context." Here, we show how to apply each of these methods from scratch using LangGraph.

Repo:
https://github.com/langchain-ai/how_to_fix_your_context

Blog:
https://www.dbreunig.com/2025/06/26/how-to-fix-your-context.html

Slides:
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1UqJ9xB0QQuyQbILRxgsSyIgobtu3GpzoRrHrUwj7cCI/edit?usp=sharing

videos.title: Why you should care about AI interpretability - Mark Bissell, Goodfire AI
videos.description:
The goal of mechanistic interpretability is to reverse engineer neural networks. Having direct, programmable access to the internal neurons of models unlocks new ways for developers and users to interact with AI ‚Äî from more precise steering to guardrails to novel user interfaces. While interpretability has long been an interesting research topic, it is now finding real-world use cases, making it an important tool for AI engineers.

About Mark Bissell
Mark Bissell is an applied researcher at Goodfire AI working on real-world applications for mechanistic interpretability. He recently joined Goodfire after 3 years at Palantir, where he worked on various U.S. healthcare initiatives including research projects with the NIH, vaccine distribution during the Covid pandemic (Operation Warp Speed), and AI-enabled hospital operations across many of the nation's leading health systems.

Mark is passionate about translating frontier research into practical solutions. He believes that recent AI developments increase the importance broad skillsets, and that roles of the future will blur the lines between traditionally distinct categories such as engineer, researcher, inventor, designer, and entrepreneur.

Recorded at the AI Engineer World's Fair in San Francisco. Stay up to date on our upcoming events and content by joining our newsletter here: https://www.ai.engineer/newsletter

videos.title: Strategies for LLM Evals (GuideLLM, lm-eval-harness, OpenAI Evals Workshop) ‚Äî¬†Taylor Jordan Smith
videos.description:
Accuracy scores and leaderboard metrics look impressive‚Äîbut production-grade AI requires evals that reflect real-world performance, reliability, and user happiness. Traditional benchmarks rarely help you understand how your LLM will perform when embedded in complex workflows or agentic systems. How can you realistically and adequately measure reasoning quality, agent consistency, MCP integration, and user-focused outcomes?

In this practical, example-driven talk, we'll go beyond standard benchmarks and dive into tangible evaluation strategies using various open-source frameworks like GuideLLM and lm-eval-harness. You'll see concrete examples of how to create custom eval suites tailored to your use case, integrate human-in-the-loop feedback effectively, and implement agent reliability checks that reflect production conditions. Walk away with actionable insights and best practices for evaluating and improving your LLMs, ensuring they meet real-world expectations‚Äînot just leaderboard positions!
---
Benchmarks and leaderboards are helpful‚Äîbut they rarely reflect the realities of production AI. Evaluating real-world performance demands deeper insight into reasoning quality, agent reliability, user satisfaction, and integration with agentic systems and MCP (Model Context Protocol).

This hands-on workshop teaches you tangible evaluation methods using popular open-source frameworks (GuideLLM, lm-eval-harness, OpenAI Evals). No prior evaluation expertise required!

You‚Äôll learn how to:

- Build custom evaluation workflows beyond traditional accuracy benchmarks.
- Evaluate reasoning skills, consistency, and reliability in agentic AI applications.
- Integrate human-in-the-loop assessments for better user-aligned outcomes.
- Validate MCP and agent interactions with practical reliability tests.

Whether you're deploying chatbots, copilots, or autonomous AI agents, robust evaluation is critical. Join us to learn actionable strategies to confidently deploy your LLMs in real-world applications.

---related links---

https://www.linkedin.com/in/taylorjordansmith/
https://www.redhat.com/en/products/ai

videos.title: Build POWERFUL Softwares in the Era of AI (Business Idea to Earn $$$)
videos.description:
# üöÄ Build Powerful AI Software That Stands Out & Earn Millions | Software 3.0 Revolution

Discover how to build cutting-edge AI software in this comprehensive breakdown of Andrej Karpathy's groundbreaking presentation on Software in the Era of AI. Learn the three revolutionary approaches to software development that will dominate 2025 and beyond!

## üéØ What You'll Learn:

**üìä Software Evolution Explained:**
- **Software 1.0:** Manual line-by-line coding (traditional GitHub repositories)
- **Software 2.0:** Neural network weights that generate code (Hugging Face models)
- **Software 3.0:** English prompts that create software directly - "English is the hottest new programming language"

**ü§ñ Three Ways to Build AI-Powered Software:**

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ **Partially Autonomous Applications**
- Real-world examples: GitHub Copilot & Cursor IDE
- Understanding LLM integration architecture:
  - Context window packaging
  - Multi-model orchestration (embedding, chat, diff models)
  - Application-specific GUI design
  - Autonomy levels in Cursor:
    - **Command K:** Partial code selection
    - **Command L:** Whole file review/modification
    - **Command I:** Entire codebase review/modification
- Why partial autonomy beats full Iron Man agents
- Focus on "Iron Man suits" vs "Iron Man robots"
- Building reliable software with human supervision

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ **Speed Up Generation & Verification Loop**
- **Generation Strategy:** Keep AI on tight leash with detailed, specific prompts
- **Verification Strategy:** Make human review fast and easy
- Targeted software examples:
  - Course creation apps for teachers
  - Course serving apps for students
- Why specificity beats generic prompts
- Controlling agent behavior through detailed instructions

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ **Build Software FOR LLMs**
- **llms.txt Implementation:** Markdown documentation for AI agents
  - Live examples: Vercel & Stripe
  - Detailed vs. summary documentation (llms-full.txt)
- **Agent-Friendly Actions:** Curl commands and terminal instructions
- **Repository Conversion Tools:**
  - **Gitingest.com:** Auto-converts GitHub repos to markdown
  - **Deepwiki.com:** Creates LLM-focused documentation
- Why agent-readable documentation is more efficient than web browsing

## üèéÔ∏è 2025: The Year of Agents

**Tesla Autopilot Analogy:**
- Current autonomous capabilities vs. full autonomy goals
- The 10+ year journey from demo to production (2013-2024)
- Demo-to-product gap challenges
- **2025-2035:** The decade of AI agents according to Andrej Karpathy

## üíª Vibe Coding: Reality Check

**What Works:**
- Local development with simple prompts
- Children creating applications
- Karpathy's menu-gen.app example (automatic image generation for restaurant menus)

**Current Limitations:**
- LLM API key management
- Flux image generation APIs
- Vercel deployments
- Domain name configuration
- Authentication systems
- Payment processing
- Production-ready deployment challenges

**Verdict:** Vibe coding works locally but still has significant production gaps

## üß† Future of Large Language Models

**LLMs as Electricity Utility:**
- **Grid Building** = Base model training
- **Electricity Supply** = Model serving & token pricing
- **Quality Demands:** Low latency, high uptime, consistent performance
- **Transfer Switch Concept:** Open Router for model switching

**LLM Operating System (LLM OS):**
- **CPU:** The LLM itself
- **RAM:** Context window
- **Internet Access:** Web browsing capabilities
- **Inter-LLM Communication:** Agent-to-agent conversations
- **File System:** Document and file access
- **Tools Integration:** Calculator, Python interpreter, terminal
- **Peripherals:** Video/audio input/output

**Model Ecosystem:**
- **Closed Source:** OpenAI, Gemini
- **Open Source:** Llama variants
- **Switching Flexibility:** Choose based on features, performance, style, capabilities

**Evolution Parallel:**
- **Past:** Expensive centralised computers with time-sharing
- **Present:** Cloud-hosted LLMs (OpenAI, Gemini)
- **Future:** Edge device AI models on personal devices

## üß© LLM Psychology Deep Dive

**Understanding LLMs as Simulated People:**
- Stochastic simulations with emergent psychology
- Auto-regressive transformer architecture as a simulator
- Vast knowledge storage with working memory limitations

https://docs.praison.ai/docs/index

0:00 - Introduction to Software in the Era of AI
0:32 - What is Software 3.0 (Code ‚Üí Weights ‚Üí Prompts)
1:45 - Building Partially Autonomous Software (Copilot/Cursor Examples)
3:51 - Speeding Up Generation and Verification Loops
5:09 - Building Software for LLMs (llms.txt, Documentation for Agents)
7:31 - 2025: The Year of Agents
8:18 - Is Vibe Coding Working? (Local vs Production Gap)
9:31 - Future of LLMs as Operating Systems
12:49 - LLM Psychology and Limitations
13:48 - Conclusion: Three Key Strategies for AI-Era Software

videos.title: Introducing Lakebase - Databricks Co-founder & Chief Architect Reynold Xin
videos.description:
Introducing Lakebase, the first fully-managed, multicloud, Postgres-compatible transactional database engine designed for developers and AI agents. 

Many organizations find that their data layer doesn't scale with their AI applications, leading to an explosion of pipelines that must be managed at all integration points.

Lakebase combines the familiarity of Postgres with the scalability of the lakehouse and the agility of Neon's database branching technology. The result is a fundamentally better way to build data-driven applications and AI agents.

videos.title: How I Made Coding 10x Faster With One Simple Setup! (Task Master)
videos.description:
# üöÄ How I 10x My Workflow on Cursor with One Setup That Changed Everything Task Master

Discover the game-changing Cursor setup that eliminates 90% of dependency errors and lets you build complex applications in minutes, not hours! This comprehensive tutorial shows you how to manage entire project context without losing focus using TaskMaster AI and Ollama.

https://github.com/eyaltoledano/claude-task-master

## üî• What You'll Learn

**Revolutionary Workflow Benefits:**
- Eliminate 90% of dependency errors automatically
- Build complex applications in minutes instead of hours
- Manage entire project context without losing focus
- Convert main projects into organized subtasks effortlessly
- Check task complexity for better project management
- Create sub-subtasks using AI-generated prompts
- Automatic next-step detection and task execution

**Problems This Setup Solves:**
- Hours wasted fixing dependency issues
- Context switching that kills your development flow
- Half-finished projects scattered everywhere
- Manual task management inefficiencies

**What You Get Instead:**
- AI manages all dependencies automatically
- One Cursor, one flow, pure focus
- Ship complete applications in single sessions
- Streamlined development process from start to finish

## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Technologies Covered

**Main Tools:**
- **TaskMaster AI** - Advanced task management system with loads of GitHub stars
- **Ollama** - Local AI model runner for free LLM usage
- **Qwen 3** - Large language model running locally on your computer
- **Cursor IDE** - AI-powered development environment

**Supported IDEs:**
- Cursor (primary focus)
- Windsurf
- VS Code
- Rue Code

**Tech Stack Demonstrated:**
- Frontend development
- Backend with Python Flask
- CRM application development
- Task automation and management

## üìã Step-by-Step Setup Process

### **1. Initial Setup**
- Download and install Ollama from ollama.com
- Configure terminal within Cursor IDE
- Install Qwen 3 model using `ollama pull qwen3`
- Install TaskMaster AI package via npm

### **2. TaskMaster Configuration**
- Initialize TaskMaster with `taskmaster init`
- Configure Ollama as the model provider
- Set up Qwen 3 as primary and fallback model
- Complete model configuration for optimal performance

### **3. Project Planning**
- Create Project Requirement Document (PRD)
- Generate detailed PRD for CRM application
- Define frontend and Python Flask backend requirements
- Review and customize requirements based on your needs

### **4. Task Generation**
- Use `taskmaster parse prd` command to generate tasks
- Automatic creation of 10+ organized tasks
- View complete task list with `taskmaster list`
- Zero-cost task generation using local models

### **5. Development Execution**
- Configure Cursor rules automatically generated by TaskMaster
- Enable auto-run mode (previously YOLO mode) for faster development
- Follow task-by-task implementation process
- Real-time error fixing and application testing

## üéØ Practical Demonstration

**CRM Application Build:**
- Complete CRM application development from scratch
- User registration and authentication system
- Dashboard with metrics (total users, leads, contacts, companies)
- Recent activity tracking
- Error handling and real-time fixes during development


## üí° Advanced Features

**TaskMaster Commands:**
- `taskmaster help` - View all available commands
- `taskmaster parse prd` - Generate subtasks from requirements
- `taskmaster list` - Display all current tasks
- `taskmaster next` - Proceed to next task in sequence
- `taskmaster models setup` - Configure different AI models

**Model Flexibility:**
- Local Ollama models for free usage
- Support for Anthropic models (Claude)
- Google AI model integration
- OpenAI model compatibility
- OpenRouter model access

**Configuration Options:**
- Environment variable setup for various AI providers
- Cursor rules automatic generation
- Windsurf and VS Code compatibility
- Custom model provider configuration

## üîß Troubleshooting & Optimization

**Common Issues Addressed:**
- Dependency error resolution
- Model configuration problems
- Application runtime errors
- Database setup and user management
- Registration and login functionality

videos.title: Google's A2A: EASILY make AI to talk to another AI
videos.description:
# üöÄ Google's A2A Protocol: AI Agents Talking to AI Agents - The Future is HERE!

**Discover how Google's revolutionary A2A (Agent-to-Agent) protocol is changing everything! Watch AI agents hire other AI agents and work together seamlessly - this is the breakthrough we've been waiting for.**

https://github.com/google/a2a-python
https://github.com/google/a2a-python/tree/main/examples
https://developers.googleblog.com/en/a2a-a-new-era-of-agent-interoperability/

PraisonAI 
MCP Server: https://docs.praison.ai/docs/mcp/mcp-server (Server Agent)
MCP Client: https://docs.praison.ai/docs/mcp/sse (Client Agent)

MCP Server vs MCP Client
MCP Stdio vs MCP SSE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qdx5uqnMJNI

## üî• What You'll Learn in This Video

**The AI Integration Problem:**
- Why current AI tools work in isolation and create integration nightmares
- The exponential complexity of coordinating multiple AI systems
- Manual coordination challenges between different AI platforms
- No standard way for AIs to discover each other

**Revolutionary Solution - A2A Protocol:**
- Complete introduction to Agent-to-Agent communication standard
- How A2A works like "USB for AI agents" - universal connectivity
- Open standard allowing AI agents from different companies to work together
- Live demonstration of one AI agent talking to another AI agent

**Technical Deep Dive:**
- Step-by-step code walkthrough and implementation guide
- Running A2A server and client setup from scratch
- Complete explanation of what happens behind the scenes
- How to replicate the entire setup yourself

**MCP vs A2A Comparison:**
- Detailed breakdown of Model Context Protocol (MCP) vs A2A
- When to use MCP for tools vs A2A for agent coordination
- Key differences in functionality and use cases
- Which protocol fits your specific needs

**Core Components Explained:**
- **Agent Skill:** Tool calling and access information
- **Agent Card:** Complete agent information and capabilities
- **Agent Executor:** Large language model integration layer
- How these components work together seamlessly

**Framework Integration:**
- LangGraph integration examples and tutorials
- Google's Agent Development Kit implementation
- CrewAI, AutoGen, and other multi-agent framework compatibility
- Direct OpenAI and Anthropic API integration methods

**Communication Methods:**
- Request-response patterns for agent communication
- Streaming responses and real-time interaction
- Push notifications and state management
- JSON-RPC over HTTP implementation details

## üõ†Ô∏è Simple 3-Line Alternative

**Bonus Content:** Learn how to achieve the same agent-to-agent communication with just **3 lines of code** using an alternative approach that's incredibly simple to implement!

## ‚úÖ What's Great About A2A Protocol

- **JSON-RPC Schema:** Standardized communication protocol
- **Agent Marketplace Concept:** Easy discovery and integration
- **Agent Cards:** Complete capability description system
- **Right-sized Model Selection:** Pick optimal models for specific tasks
- **Built-in Authentication:** Security handled automatically
- **Task State Management:** Track complex, long-running operations

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Current Limitations

- **Beta Version Status:** Still in development phase
- **Limited Production Tooling:** Not fully production-ready yet
- **Multi-Agent Complexity:** Coordination challenges at scale
- **Debugging Difficulties:** Limited tracing and conversation debugging
- **Reliability Concerns:** Testing and stability improvements needed

## üåü Real-World Applications

**The Future of AI Agents:**
- **Shopping Agents:** Negotiate automatically with seller agents
- **Calendar Coordination:** Cross-company meeting scheduling
- **Healthcare Integration:** Seamless data sharing between providers
- **Educational Personalization:** Content agents creating custom learning experiences
- **Business Negotiations:** Multi-vendor deal handling and coordination

## üîß Technical Requirements

- **Python 3.13** (recommended version)
- **Virtual Environment Setup** (conda or venv)
- **GitHub Repository Access** - Full code examples available
- **CLI Tools** included for easy setup and testing
- **JavaScript and Python** support for cross-platform development

#AIAgents #A2AProtocol #GoogleAI #ArtificialIntelligence #MachineLearning #AIIntegration #MultiAgentSystems #TechTutorial #AIAutomation #FutureOfAI

videos.title: Model Content Protocol Course from Hugging Face - MCP Course Introduction
videos.description:
This video is the first unit in the Hugging Face Model Content Protocol Course.

Welcome to the ü§ó Model Context Protocol (MCP) Course Organization!
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) Course is your comprehensive guide to understanding, using, and building cutting-edge AI applications that leverage external data and tools through the latest MCP standards. This free course is designed to take you from beginner to an informed practitioner in the world of MCP.

MCP Course
üöÄ Ready to Join? Enroll in the MCP Course!
Join the Course
üöÄ What to Expect from This Course?
In this course, you will:

üìñ Study Model Context Protocol in theory, design, and practice.
üßë‚Äçüíª Learn to use established MCP SDKs and frameworks.
üíæ Share your projects and explore applications created by the community.
üèÜ Participate in challenges and evaluate your MCP implementations.
üéì Earn a certificate of completion by completing assignments.
Our goal is to help you understand how MCP works and empower you to build your own AI applications.

üìö Course Structure
The course is composed of:

Foundational Units: Learn MCP concepts in theory.
Use Case Assignments: Apply learned concepts to real-world problems.
Collaborations: Featuring the latest MCP implementations and tools from Hugging Face and its partners.

videos.title: N8N + WhatsApp GR√ÅTIS: Crie seu Agente de IA sem gastar NADA! (Tutorial f√°cil para iniciantes 2025)
videos.description:
Aprenda a criar um Chatbot no Whatsapp sem gastar NADA, utilizando o N8N e uma API de Whatsapp gratuita (WAHA)!

üü¶ Meu Curso N8N F√°cil: https://guilhermelaz.com.br/curso

üü™ VPS Hostinger:  https://guilhermelaz.com.br/hostingerVps
üëÜüèª Use o cupom de desconto GUILHERMELAZ para 10% de desconto EXTRA! üëÜüèª

üí° Ofertas e recomenda√ß√µes:
üü¶ Meu Curso N8N Agentes de IA Chatbots Inteligentes: https://guilhermelaz.com.br/curso
üü™ Planos na Hostinger:  https://guilhermelaz.com.br/hostingerVps

Links do v√≠deo:
üê≥ Download do arquivo docker-compose.yml: https://guilhermelaz.com.br/n8n-waha-local
üîë Chave de API do Google Gemini: https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Passo a Passo do V√≠deo:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Instalar o Docker no seu computador:

Baixe o aplicativo Docker Desktop de acordo com o seu sistema operacional (Windows, MacOS ou Linux): https://docker.com

Obs: No Linux existe um passo extra. Ap√≥s baixar o Docker Desktop, voc√™ precisar√° abrir um terminal (CMD) e executar o comando:

sudo apt install docker-compose

2Ô∏è‚É£ Baixe o arquivo docker-compose.yml do Github:

Fa√ßa download do arquivo docker-compose.yml no Github: https://guilhermelaz.com.br/n8n-waha-local

3Ô∏è‚É£ Crie uma pasta com o arquivo dentro, e execute o comando no terminal:

Nos seus downloads, crie uma nova pasta com nome "N8N WAHA Local" ou parecido, e coloque o arquivo docker-compose.yml dentro dela.

Depois abra essa pasta com o arquivo dentro, abra um terminal nela clicando com o bot√£o direito e "abrir no terminal" e execute o comando:

docker-compose up -d

Aguarde o docker baixar e subir os containers dos aplicativos.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Conectar seu Whatsapp no WAHA:

Ap√≥s baixar tudo, abra o aplicativo Docker Desktop e voc√™ ver√° uma nova stack de containers com os aplicativos N8N e WAHA, e os bancos de dados Redis e Postgres. Para acess√°-los basta clicar na porta do container atrav√©s da tabela de exibi√ß√£o (formato xxxx:xxxx).
Acesse o WAHA atrav√©s do navegador clicando na porta 3000:3000 pelo aplicativo Docker Desktop, depois clique em "Dashboard" logo em cima.
No dashboard, inicie a sess√£o default j√° existente e leia o QR Code que aparece clicando em "Login".

5Ô∏è‚É£ Configurar o N8N:

Ap√≥s entrar no WAHA com seu Whatsapp, volte ao aplicativo do Docker Desktop e acesse o N8N, clicando na porta 5678:5678 e fa√ßa as configura√ß√µes da sua conta.

Ap√≥s criar a conta, informe um e-mail para receber uma chave de ativa√ß√£o gratuita do N8N. Isso ir√° te ajudar liberando algumas fun√ß√µes extras.

Copie a chave que chega em seu e-mail, e no painel do N8N, v√° nos tr√™s pontinhos do canto inferior esquerdo, clique em settings, e depois "Enter Activation Key" na tela que aparece, e informe a chave que recebeu.

Ap√≥s ativar o N8N, v√° para o painel "Community Nodes" (do lado esquerdo da tela, ainda em settings), clique em "Install a community node" e digite:

n8n-nodes-waha

Clique em "Install" e aguarde.

Pronto! A configura√ß√£o do N8N est√° feita e agora podemos montar o Workflow.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Montar o Workflow:

Crie um novo workflow, adicione um Trigger de "Webhook" e o configure da seguinte forma:

HTTP Method: POST
Path: webhook

Depois copie a URL de teste que aparece logo acima, v√° no Dashboard do Waha, configura√ß√µes da sua sess√£o, "+ Webhook", cole a URL, em events deixe apenas o "message" e clique em "Update".

Ap√≥s isso volte ao N8N, clique para esperar um evento de teste e envie uma mensagem para o seu n√∫mero conectado no WAHA atrav√©s de OUTRO N√öMERO (um segundo n√∫mero, de algum familiar, amigo, etc. N√£o funciona com o pr√≥prio n√∫mero da sess√£o).

Ap√≥s receber os dados, adicione um node "Set" em frente ao Webhook e salve crie os seguintes campos:

session = session
event = event
chatId = from
pushName = pushName (O outro que est√° l√° em baixo, dentro de _data)
payload_id = id
message = body
fromMe = fromMe

Teste e depois adicione um novo node, dessa vez um "Switch" em frente ao SET. Neste switch apenas fa√ßa a compara√ß√£o, se o "event" for igual a "message" e siga o fluxo normal.

Adicione o node do AI Agent e fa√ßa as configura√ß√µes de prompt, system prompt, chat model e memory.

Pegue a chave de API gratuita do Google Gemini aqui: https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey

A configura√ß√£o do node do Redis Chat Memory √© a seguinte:

Password: default
Host: host.docker.internal

Depois adicione um Node do WAHA para visualizar a mensagem, passando as configura√ß√µes de Sess√£o, Chat ID e Payload ID.

E por fim, adicione um Node do WAHA para responder a mensagem, passando as configura√ß√µes de Sess√£o, Chat ID e TEXT, onde TEXT √© o Output gerado pelo node do Agente de IA.

Pronto! Agora voc√™ tem o seu pr√≥prio fluxo de Agente de IA integrado ao Whatsapp feito de forma 100% gratuita, sem gastar nada!

videos.description:

Learn how to build a sophisticated WhatsApp AI agent using N8N workflow automation in this step-by-step tutorial. Transform your WhatsApp experience with an intelligent assistant capable of processing text, images, and voice messages while responding with both text and audio replies. This comprehensive guide walks you through the entire process from setting up the Meta Developer platform to creating a fully functional AI-powered WhatsApp bot. The tutorial covers everything you need: configuring the WhatsApp Business Cloud API, building dynamic N8N workflows, implementing OpenAI for voice transcription and image analysis, and creating conditional paths for different message types.

Key features demonstrated include:
- Processing and responding to text messages
- Transcribing voice messages and generating audio responses
- Analyzing images and answering questions about them
- Maintaining conversation memory and context
- Integrating web search for real-time information
- Accessing emails and to-do lists

Perfect for automation enthusiasts, business owners wanting to enhance customer service, or developers looking to build practical AI applications. Download the workflow template for free and start building your own WhatsApp AI agent today!

videos.title: This VIBECODING LLM Runs LOCALLY! ü§Ø
videos.description:
You can start vibecoding right now! 

OpenHands LM is built on the foundation of Qwen Coder 2.5 Instruct 32B, leveraging its powerful base capabilities for coding tasks. What sets OpenHands LM apart is our specialized fine-tuning process:

We used training data generated by OpenHands itself on a diverse set of open-source repositories
Specifically, we use an RL-based framework outlined in SWE-Gym, where we set up a training environment, generate training data using an existing agent, and then fine-tune the model on examples that were resolved successfully
It features a 128K token context window, ideal for handling large codebases and long-horizon software engineering tasks

Model link - https://huggingface.co/all-hands/openhands-lm-7b-v0.1
