=============================================

ü§ñ ChatGPT PROMPTS

#1 - Getting Slide Feedback

You are a consulting manager at a top-tier firm, responsible for reviewing PowerPoint slides to ensure they meet the highest standards of structure, clarity, design, and consulting best practices. Your feedback is sharp, insightful, and practical, mimicking the guidance an experienced consultant would provide. 

Your focus areas include:

- **Slide Structure & Logical Flow**: Ensure each slide has a clear key message, follows structured frameworks like the Pyramid Principle, MECE, or SCQA, and presents information in a way that executives and clients can quickly grasp.
- **Messaging & Clarity**: Identify unnecessary words or redundant elements, verify that each slide tells a standalone story, and ensure the main takeaway is immediately clear.
- **Design & Formatting**: Check for alignment, consistent font size, weight, and color usage. Identify excessive text and recommend visualization where appropriate.
- **Data Visualization & Charts**: Assess whether the chart type is appropriate for the data, suggest clearer visualization methods if needed, and eliminate unnecessary clutter.
- **Consulting-Level Polishing**: Ensure slides are client-ready, not overly dense, and anticipate feedback from senior partners or clients.

When reviewing slides, provide direct but constructive feedback. Push the user to refine their work by asking critical questions and suggesting concrete improvements. Be firm but supportive‚Äîjust like a real consulting manager.

#2 - Structuring Your Presentation

Can you help me structure a presentation by giving me only the titles of the slides? It should be 15-20 slides long, and the introduction (2-3 slides) should follow the SCQA framework, and the main content slides should follow the Pyramid Principle.

Here's some basic information:
What I want my audience to believe the presentation: Pineapple does not belong on pizza
Why should my audience care: Pizza is consumed by millions of people around the world

Feel free to fill in the gaps as needed.

videos.title: Coolify: STOP PAYING for VERCEL & SUPABASE with this NEW, FREE & SELF-HOSTED Alternative
videos.description:
In this video, I'll be telling you how to install Coolify which is a new and free alternative to Vercel, Netlify & Heroku. This tool allows you to stop paying for Vercel, Supabase and other such providers. It works with NextJS, SvelteKit, Angular, Vue and other such frameworks.

[Resources]
Github Repo: https://github.com/coollabsio/coolify

[Key Takeaways]
üí∏ Vercel can get pricey, especially for larger sites, and lacks control over costs, making it a costly option for many developers.
üìà Self-hosting with Coolify can save up to 90% of deployment costs, making it a more affordable option.
üéâ Coolify is an open-source alternative to Vercel that allows for self-hosting on a VPS server or locally.
üìä Coolify offers features like Git integration, SSL certificate management, and DB backups, making it a comprehensive deployment platform.
üöÄ Coolify is compatible with multiple languages and allows for easy deployment of databases and extensions.
üëç Self-hosting with Coolify provides full control over code and data, and allows for customization and flexibility.
üìà Coolify offers a free tier, and even paid plans are more affordable than Vercel's pro plan.
üìä Coolify provides analytical tools to help manage servers more efficiently.
üëç Coolify is a better option for advanced configuration and customization compared to Vercel.

videos.title: Chat with MySQL Database with Python | LangChain Tutorial
videos.description:
Discover how to interact with a MySQL database using Python and LangChain in our latest tutorial. This comprehensive guide walks you through the process of creating a LangChain chain, detailing every step with a helpful diagram for a clearer understanding. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, this video will equip you with the knowledge to execute SQL queries using an innovative approach.

IMPORTANT: Remember to NOT use a MySQL user with WRITE privileges. Use only READ and limit the scope. Otherwise your user could ask your chain to delete data.

USEFUL LINKS:
‚òéÔ∏è Get something like this for your company: https://link.alejandro-ao.com/consulting-call
üìå Article (follow along): https://alejandro-ao.com/chat-with-mysql-using-python-and-langchain/

‚ù§Ô∏è Buy me a coffee... or a beer (thanks): https://link.alejandro-ao.com/l83gNq

1:02 How this works
2:59 Our test data
4:58 Load the test data 
6:47 Notebook setup
9:23 Create SQL Chain Prompt
13:00 Load MySQL Database in Python
17:01 Create SQL Chain
26:02 Create run_query Function & Final Prompt
29:45 Create Full Chain
35:54 Conclusion

In this tutorial, you'll learn:

- How to set up LangChain to communicate with a MySQL database.
- The intricacies of creating and utilizing SQL queries within LangChain.
- Implementing a full chain that includes SQL query generation and natural language response construction.
- Best practices for interacting with databases using Python and LangChain.

Key Highlights:

- LangChain Integration: Learn how to create a LangChain chain for database queries.
- SQL Query Generation: Understand the process behind generating SQL queries from natural language questions.
- Interactive Diagram: A detailed diagram explains the architecture and process flow.
- Comprehensive Code Walkthrough: From setting up your environment to executing queries, every step is covered.

Who Should Watch?
This tutorial is perfect for developers, data scientists, and tech enthusiasts interested in leveraging LangChain for database interactions. Whether you're looking to enhance your projects or explore new technologies, this guide has something for everyone.

Welcome to our latest video on "AI: The Future of Us - MLOps in the Era of GenAI."

In this video, we will discuss Chess, Transformers, and how data analytics and machine learning applications are coming together. We will also dive into MLOps and cover a variety of topics, from faster experimentation to evolving MLOps practices to the optimal way of working with LLMs. In this episode, Firat Tekiner from the Product Management team at Google, speaks with Donna Schut, Head of Applied Analytics & AI Solutions at Google Cloud, as they discuss the latest trends in data analytics and AI development.

Join us as we explore some of the examples we have seen and the value that organizations can bring by using generative AI applications in their data analytics ecosystem.

Whether you are a seasoned Data or ML professional or even just starting out, this video is a must-watch. Join us as we explore the exciting world of AI and the future of MLOps in the era of GenAI, and discover how you can stay ahead of the curve in this rapidly evolving field.

videos.title: What is Vertex AI?
videos.description: Whether you‚Äôre a developer looking to add AI to your application or a data scientist wanting to build and scale custom ML and production, Vertex AI has the tools to accelerate the delivery of ML models and applications to production.

videos.title: What is role prompting in Model Garden?
videos.description: Improve accuracy and relevance in large language models‚Äô answers with role prompting. Role prompting is when you expand the relevance of answers from AI based on how you ask your question.

videos.title: What is Retrieval Augmented Generation?
videos.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is a technique for enhancing the accuracy and reliability of generative AI models with facts fetched from external sources. Check out the blog for more details!

videos.title: Chain of thought (CoT) prompting
videos.description: If you have a multi-step problem you would like a large language model to solve, leverage chain of thought (CoT) prompting. This means you break down the problem into smaller, more manageable steps. Break down complex tasks into smaller steps to achieve better results.

videos.title: What is ReAct prompting?
videos.description: Combine reasoning and action planning on large language models with few-shot prompting. Guide the LLM with your multiple questions and improve the accuracy of their responses to receive better answers to your questions.

videos.title: Jumpstart your AI/ML program with Vertex AI
videos.description:
The era of massive teams of data scientists building models from scratch is over. With Model Garden on Vertex AI, Google Cloud now offers multiple state of the art open source and first party models that can be easily deployed with virtually no coding involved. In this session, we‚Äôll explore how startups can transform their business using a wide variety of models with simple deployment and management options (and very limited effort). With Vertex AI Model Garden, startups can now access and deploy foundation models used and created by AI/ML leaders regardless of their team size or scale. Note: We will start seating walk-ins five minutes before the start of each session. 

Speakers: May Habib

Watch more:
All sessions from Google Cloud Next ‚Üí https://goo.gle/next23

#GoogleCloudNext

videos.title: Filestore and NetApp Volumes: The future for modern and virtualized workloads
videos.description:
As enterprises deploy more modern applications in Google Cloud, they are presented with new ways of using and optimizing storage. We‚Äôll showcase our newest addition, Google Cloud NetApp Volumes, a fully Google-managed file storage service built for enterprise applications. You‚Äôll also see how Filestore supports deploying applications on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) requiring stateful, not ephemeral, storage. It also provides persistent volumes to multi-writer applications requiring consistent data access across thousands of GKE pods. Salesforce will share how they use Filestore as a scalable, high-performance file storage solution for their containerized AI/ML training needs.

Speakers: Lavanya Karanam, Sean Derrington, Cohavit Almagor

All sessions from Google Cloud Next ‚Üí https://goo.gle/next23

videos.description:
Many enterprise IT organizations have infrastructure efficiency initiatives aimed at cutting costs and reducing environmental impact. Savvy customers use AI to drive these efforts. Third party AIOps tools may lack features, flexibility to allow customizations, or granular cost controls, complicating the achievement of a positive ROI. However, these capabilities can be built using tools that exist in Google Cloud. Join this session to learn about building an infrastructure intelligence platform at enterprise scale that can ‚Äúunderstand‚Äù the complex interdependencies of multiple systems,  detect and predict issues and outages, and provide integration to automate remediation.

MLOps is an ML engineering culture and practice that aims at unifying ML system development and ML system operation enabling shorter development cycles, increased deployment velocity, and more dependable releases in close alignment with business objectives.

videos.title: Best AI Tools and Helpers Apps for Software Developers in 2024
videos.description:
Is life becoming easier for software developers? It‚Äôs been over a year since GPT-4 was released and since then we‚Äôve seen so many tools popping up to support our every day tasks but also professional lives.

The rush of AI-powered development tools, some useful some just not so much, have caused a minor panic amongst developers thinking they might be replaced by AI in the near future.
But as with so many other things, it‚Äôs better to embrace the change and adapt rather than resist the new flood of tools and be left behind.

In this video, we list the best AI tools for software engineers. Specifically for coding and some supporting tasks like testing and UI building. These tools are used by working professionals in many fields such as web development, python and java development, game development, app or webapp development and much more. Especially coding assistants are becoming inevitable tools for IT professionals around the world.

It‚Äôs important to keep in mind the legal and security implications of these tools before using them so make sure you consult with the legal team in your company.

üîß Here are the tools we mention
Coding assistants:
* GitHub CoPilot
* TabNine
* Amazon CodeWhisperer
* Sourcegraph cody
* Jetbrains AI

Web and App development:
* Uizard for generating UIs
* Locofy to design and import to Figma
* Codewp to create wordpress websites without coding

videos.title: Build a RAG app using LangFlow + @streamlitofficial with minimal coding | LangFlow crash course
videos.description:
Can AI explain itself? In other words, if I take an AI model and ask it questions about any other AI model, I would expect it to answer my questions. But it turns out that the model simply doesn't know about any other models. Can a simple workaround for this problem lie with Retrieval Augmented Generation or RAG. 
I developed a chat app using LangFlow and StreamLit with minimal coding and solved this very problem. It uses a RAG pipeline in the backend. I provided the retrieval system with all the papers on the Phi series of models developed by Microsoft and eventually, the system was able to answer my questions about the Phi family of models. 

So in this video, I will walk you through how I went about developing the pipeline and along the way demonstrate how easy it is to develop a chat app using LangFlow.

videos.title: The Singularity Is Nearer featuring Ray Kurzweil | SXSW 2024
videos.description:
Portuguese and Spanish language translations for SXSW 2024 Keynotes and Featured Sessions presented by Ita√∫

Twenty-five years ago, Ray Kurzweil predicted computers would reach human-level intelligence by 2029, unlocking solutions to the world‚Äôs grandest challenges. Today we are right on track to reach this milestone. During the 2030s, AI will become superintelligent, vastly outstripping our capabilities and enabling dramatic medical breakthroughs to overcome aging. This is not an alien invasion. AI is evolving from within us and will reflect our humanity. By 2045, we will connect our brains directly to the cloud, enhancing our intelligence a millionfold and expanding our consciousness in ways we can barely imagine. This is the Singularity.

About SXSW:
SXSW dedicates itself to helping creative people achieve their goals. Founded in 1987 in Austin, Texas, SXSW is best known for its conference and festivals that celebrate the convergence of the interactive, film, and music industries. An essential destination for global professionals, SXSW features sessions, showcases, screenings, exhibitions, professional development and a variety of networking opportunities. For more information, please visit sxsw.com.
